commit_message:
Fix bug to api-ref

The API reference for the server 'migrate' (cold migrate) action
doesn't mention any asynchronous post conditions. We should have
something similar to what's in the 'resize' action API reference.

Change-Id: I596b95cbd276e8d16a1cc8ce20d77f0ff6985317
Closes-bug: #1774234

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 09:37:18.000000000', 'message': "apache wsgi: Exchange defaults for workers and threads

Due to Python's GIL [1], we can't use multiple threads for running
OpenStack services without a performance penalty, since the execution
ends up serialized, which defeats the purpose.

Instead, we should use several processes, since this approach doesn't
have this limitation.

[1] https://wiki.python.org/moin/GlobalInterpreterLock

Conflicts:
      manifests/wsgi/apache.pp

Change-Id: Ifd7ec428442da08d9aa85718b7b8553ca75c1b5c
(cherry picked from commit f039a52f8f6d80f92b0a3c994cc36e5a1c82a87e)
"}]
commit_message:
apache wsgi: Exchange defaults for workers and threads

Due to Python's GIL [1], we can't use multiple threads for running
OpenStack services without a performance penalty, since the execution
ends up serialized, which defeats the purpose.

Instead, we should use several processes, since this approach doesn't
have this limitation.

[1] https://wiki.python.org/moin/GlobalInterpreterLock

Conflicts:
      manifests/wsgi/apache.pp

Change-Id: Ifd7ec428442da08d9aa85718b7b8553ca75c1b5c
(cherry picked from commit f039a52f8f6d80f92b0a3c994cc36e5a1c82a87e)

commit_message:
Add info about source execution to a workflow execution description

* When Mistral starts a new workflow based on an existing workflow
  execution object it needs to save the information about the source
  execution into the "description" field".

Closes-Bug: #1762470

Change-Id: I0ae154b008b6c8fb7e51bf6cc669ad6ca9a2a900

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 10:54:03.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I883f658daee933a0ac2cfdcf25a625c82eb33d27
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I883f658daee933a0ac2cfdcf25a625c82eb33d27

commit_message:
Fix invalid escape sequence warnings

There are a lot of DeprecationWarning message emited when running
under python 3.6 due mostly to non-raw strings being used for
regex expressions.

DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \

These had previously been ignored, but starting with python 3.6,
and the commit for issue 27364, these are now considered deprecated
and will no longer be supported going forward. Per the discussion
on that issue, these strings should really be raw strings any way:

https://bugs.python.org/issue27364#msg272696

Change-Id: If6ff206e4bbcf10ab52d2895f606dafad2936ddb

commit_message:
Fix the `role implies list` command.

The code was calling an unexisting function which never existed.
The module refers now to the correct `InferenceRuleManager`. It
also allows the compatibility with the future python-keystoneclient
in which the compatibility method will be removed from the
RoleManager.

Change-Id: I08f785dc9e840da2e16915683eecfe49189c44b3

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-03-16 11:01:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks for working on this.

The code looks good to me, but I'm not sure I'm OK with this, as I believe it is as incorrect saying that the backend is up as it is to say it is down, in both cases you are giving only partial information.

Since this is changing the API behavior we require a new microversion, and since we are already doing that, I would go with adding a new state to the API that can convey the message that we have a mix of up and down pools.

And we are missing the release note."}, {'account_id': 20146, 'date': '2018-06-24 03:21:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-16 02:07:08.000000000', 'message': "Volume backend with several pools may return wrong backend state

If volume backend is consists of two pools，one of the pool's backend
state is up and another is down, the backend state would be down. This
patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Ibd2b87049d3a056b18d192c13a0f33afa7e2e5b8
Closes-Bug: #1756222
"}]
commit_message:
Volume backend with several pools may return wrong backend state

If volume backend is consists of two pools，one of the pool's backend
state is up and another is down, the backend state would be down. This
patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Ibd2b87049d3a056b18d192c13a0f33afa7e2e5b8
Closes-Bug: #1756222

[{'created': '2018-06-20 15:52:39.000000000', 'message': 'Increase pylint processes

The default process concurrency for pylint is 1. Since our gate
images used to run the job have 8 cores, this results in slower
job execution with many cores sitting idle. To speed things up,
this sets the process count to match the number of cores available.

Change-Id: If4ba3333a1cb3b8bb6b4797f9149f412d32047ef
'}]
commit_message:
Increase pylint processes

The default process concurrency for pylint is 1. Since our gate
images used to run the job have 8 cores, this results in slower
job execution with many cores sitting idle. To speed things up,
this sets the process count to match the number of cores available.

Change-Id: If4ba3333a1cb3b8bb6b4797f9149f412d32047ef

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2018-03-31 02:01:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2018-03-31 02:02:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-04-03 09:42:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

Thanks for this, it has been on my todo list for a bit.
The reason I've been waiting is that the orchestrate-tempest only exists on devstack master for now (back port to be done). Because of that tempest-full-queens and tempest-full-pike should not be passing, but they are, which is rather worrying. 
The -2 is until that's clarified and back port done, otherwise this is definitely the way to go."}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-04-03 09:53:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I verified that tempest-full-queens is running devstack from stable/queens (see at the end http://logs.openstack.org/78/557878/3/check/tempest-full-queens/302d6ce/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2018-03-31_02_32_50_209), so my guess is that zuul is doing some role discovery magic and falling back to master branch for the role that was not found. Until that's clarified though I'd rather wait on this."}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-04-03 21:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I found my patch where I started working on this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545724.
It was failing on stable branches as it should.

Jim investigated this and it seems to be a bug in zuul that is causing zuul to use the master version of roles from devstack.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-04-09 17:57:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2018-06-24 01:22:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Use orchestrate-devstack instead of run-devstack

Run devstack on controller first and on subnodes then. If use
role run-devstack only, the job which inherit devstack-tempest
job with nodeset openstack-two-node will be failed. For example,
the creation kuryr account in compute node was failed when tried
to connect keystone [1], but at that time, keystone wasn't ready
yet [2] . Services in Compute node should start after keystone
was started.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/09/512209/57/check/zun-tempest-multinode-docker-sql/329e6db/compute1/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2018-03-29_01_59_11_654
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/09/512209/57/check/zun-tempest-multinode-docker-sql/329e6db/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2018-03-29_02_01_14_351

Change-Id: I616749c62cd3c6c5200f25df2d284b91a99de585

[{'created': '2018-06-09 10:22:09.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iddea984cd32fd0b048a396cde27e3d12ae07119e
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iddea984cd32fd0b048a396cde27e3d12ae07119e

commit_message:
DataCore: get rid of pylint errors due to contextlib

Use of contextlib.closing causes pylint to not recognize the
type and causes "no memeber" errors. Since this is a locally
defined class that can simply be made into a context manager,
this removes the use of contextlib and handles it directly in
code.

Change-Id: I2b284b1ba51f848c183c3895948131de9e89d300

commit_message:
Get rid of conditional rtslib_fb imports

Newer versions of this library have been out for awhile now
and appear to be working well. This raises the minimum version
for rtslib_fb to a recent version that does not require the
conditional import due to the namespace change from rtslib to
rtslib_fb.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/575530
Change-Id: I10f48833c2a61b7b2c6b300d4f8291a357f7e600

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 21:40:08.000000000', 'message': "Adding faker to global requirements

fixtures-git uses faker to generate fake text for inserting in to files
when building test git repos for tools that wish to test with git.

Is the library actively maintained?
Yes - https://github.com/joke2k/faker
They appear to have made regular releases since 2016 averaging ~2 per
month.

Is the library good code?
Yes - Appears to be relatively straight forward to extend suggesting a
nice simple design and the documentation appears to cover most of the
different types of fake date in reasonable detail.

Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes - though only for >=3.4
https://github.com/joke2k/faker/blob/da96379c07dbd22bea070db5a8a3e1ad85e4cf04/setup.py#L43

Is the library license compatible?
Yes - MIT

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest
/ Fedora latest)?

Fedora - Not verified yet
Ubuntu - Not verified yet

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
global-requirements.txt?

I don't believe so, was unable to locate any other random text
generators.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?

Yes - fixtures-git uses it directly to generate text to be used for
testing by developer tools working with git repositories such as
git-upstream.

Change-Id: Ic1c0412fb1473465977af8244b3e61060296e7a1

commit_message:
Adding faker to global requirements

fixtures-git uses faker to generate fake text for inserting in to files
when building test git repos for tools that wish to test with git.

Is the library actively maintained?
Yes - https://github.com/joke2k/faker
They appear to have made regular releases since 2016 averaging ~2 per
month.

Is the library good code?
Yes - Appears to be relatively straight forward to extend suggesting a
nice simple design and the documentation appears to cover most of the
different types of fake data in reasonable detail.

Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes - though only for >=3.4
https://github.com/joke2k/faker/blob/da96379c07dbd22bea070db5a8a3e1ad85e4cf04/setup.py#L43

Is the library license compatible?
Yes - MIT

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest
/ Fedora latest)?

Fedora - Present since Fedora 27
Ubuntu - Present since 17.10

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
global-requirements.txt?

I don't believe so, was unable to locate any other random text
generators.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?

Yes - fixtures-git uses it directly to generate text to be used for
testing by developer tools working with git repositories such as
git-upstream.

Change-Id: Ic1c0412fb1473465977af8244b3e61060296e7a1

commit_message:
Remove legacy puppet-openstackci jobs

The required jobs for puppet-openstackci were already converted and
project-config has been updated to point to the new ones, so clean up
the old ones.

subject: Make sure we start nova-compute after ironic-conductor.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 9555, 'name': 'Matthew Booth', 'email': 'mbooth@redhat.com', 'username': 'MatthewBooth'}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 16515, 'name': 'mbu', 'email': 'mat.bultel@gmail.com', 'username': 'matbu'}, {'_account_id': 20775, 'name': 'Carlos Camacho', 'email': 'ccamacho@redhat.com', 'username': 'ccamacho'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-06-18 15:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2018-06-18 15:27:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I realise this is just a WIP patch, but my -1 here is to document that:

1. This is a dirty hack. The real fixes are in ironic and nova, which should be robust to this in the first place.

2. Dirty hacks need to be well commented so they can be confidently removed when no longer required.

For the sake of the children, please don't land this without a good comment :)"}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-06-18 15:38:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I realise this is just a WIP patch, but my -1 here is to document
 > that:
 > 
 > 1. This is a dirty hack. The real fixes are in ironic and nova,
 > which should be robust to this in the first place.
 > 
 > 2. Dirty hacks need to be well commented so they can be confidently
 > removed when no longer required.
 > 
 > For the sake of the children, please don't land this without a good
 > comment :)

Well I was about to push it in puppet-nova and realized it will be only of use on the undercloud, as the overcloud are containerized.  

But for the shake of the puppet module that could be better to do it in puppet-nova (got the patch ready as well)"}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-06-19 08:42:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2018-06-19 08:45:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

I'd love to leave you a +1 but I know nothing about this code. Gold standard comment, though ;)"}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-06-19 10:46:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Adding systemd configuration to have it working on reboot as well.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-06-19 12:46:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-06-19 12:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

systemd unit file is wrong.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-06-19 13:44:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-06-19 13:45:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Tested and got as expected results:

2018-06-16 10:47:53,445 INFO: Debug: Adding relationship from Service[openstack-ironic-conductor] to Service[openstack-nova-compute] with 'before'

2018-06-16 10:50:20,012 INFO: Notice: /Stage[main]/Ironic::Conductor/Service[ironic-conductor]/ensure: ensure changed 'stopped' to 'running'

2018-06-16 10:53:05,634 INFO: Notice: /Stage[main]/Nova::Compute/Nova::Generic_service[compute]/Service[nova-compute]/ensure: ensure changed 'stopped' to 'running'

2018-06-16 10:48:04,558 INFO: Debug: /Stage[main]/Main/Exec[systemd daemon-reload for lp1777608]/notify: subscribes to Service[nova-compute]

(undercloud) [stack@undercloud-0 ~]$ systemctl status openstack-nova-compute
● openstack-nova-compute.service - OpenStack Nova Compute Server
   Loaded: loaded (/usr/lib/systemd/system/openstack-nova-compute.service; enabled; vendor preset: disabled)
  Drop-In: /etc/systemd/system/openstack-nova-compute.service.d
           └─90-after-ironic-conductor.conf
   Active: active (running) since Sat 2018-06-16 10:53:05 EDT; 54min ago
 Main PID: 19302 (nova-compute)
    Tasks: 1
   CGroup: /system.slice/openstack-nova-compute.service
           └─19302 /usr/bin/python2 /usr/bin/nova-compute

(undercloud) [stack@undercloud-0 ~]$ cat /etc/systemd/system/openstack-nova-compute.service.d/90-after-ironic-conductor.conf
[Unit]
After=openstack-ironic-conductor.service

# After reboot
-- Reboot --
Jun 19 09:26:47 undercloud-0.redhat.local systemd[1]: Started OpenStack Ironic Conductor service.

Jun 19 09:26:58 undercloud-0.redhat.local systemd[1]: Starting OpenStack Nova Compute Server..."}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-06-19 16:00:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

Seems that the systemd After is not enough are the ironic conductor binary doens't wait for full availability of the service telling systemd that it has started, so we can't rely on it.... looking for a solution in nova-compute."}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-06-19 16:30:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Workflow

recheck we will have another in nova to wait a bit for ironic to be ready.  Both reviews should cover all cases.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-06-20 08:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576428/ should be merged now.'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2018-06-20 09:36:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

It looks like this approach can't work due to how service startup works :( Specifically, services don't report to systemd when their initialisation is complete. We need a code fix for this instead, which is in progress here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576580/"}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-06-20 09:58:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> It looks like this approach can't work due to how service startup
 > works :( Specifically, services don't report to systemd when their
 > initialisation is complete. We need a code fix for this instead,
 > which is in progress here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576580/

Well as discussed with Dan we should still include this review as the fix is hoping for the ironic-conductor to be "up" within 1 minutes.  Without ordering this may prove to be wrong more often.

Extract from the discussion on irc:

<chem> dansmith: so given we working on heuristic here I think it would still
       be a good thing to have nova-compute started after
       ironic-conductor. ... just to increase the odd                   [18:25]
<dansmith> chem: we're already starting nova-compute after ironic-conductor
           right? we were just too fast?
<chem> dansmith: not specified anywhere yet
<chem> dansmith: only in that review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576165/4
                                                           [18:27]
<dansmith> chem: ah okay, definitely need that too'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-06-20 12:04:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

[{'created': '2018-06-18 15:11:31.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Make sure we start nova-compute after ironic-conductor.

Need testing.

Basically we have a race between ironic-conductor and nova-compute.

Current detail start there in this thread:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1590297#c18

Note this would only resolve undercloud ordering, still need ordering for:
 - undercloud with container;
 - overcloud with container.

Change-Id: Ifbada53f088258a397777a6fa18dd7c1b37c09d3
TODO: make a launchpad.
'}, {'created': '2018-06-19 08:42:05.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure we start nova-compute after ironic-conductor.

We need to ensure that ironic-conductor starts before nova-compute to
avoid an issue where nova-compute try and fail to call plug_vifs
unnecessarily.

This in turn report a vm_state error which, in this case is a false
positive.

Note this only resolves undercloud ordering, we may still need ordering for:
 - undercloud with container;
 - overcloud with container.

Change-Id: Ifbada53f088258a397777a6fa18dd7c1b37c09d3
Closes-Bug: #1777475
'}, {'created': '2018-06-19 12:46:23.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure we start nova-compute after ironic-conductor.

commit_message:
Make sure we start nova-compute after ironic-conductor.

We need to ensure that ironic-conductor starts before nova-compute.
This is to workaround an issue where nova-compute tries and fails to
call plug_vifs, this in turn report a vm_state error which, in this
case is a false positive.  See lp#1777608 for more.

We ensure ordering by forcing puppet to restart nova-compute after
ironic-conductor in the case of undercloud upgrade/update.

Change-Id: Ifbada53f088258a397777a6fa18dd7c1b37c09d3
Closes-Bug: #1777475

commit_message:
Add a new parameter named cache_server_url

If you want to use horizon with a different cacheing backend you
may run into problems. E.g. with redis it expects a database after
the port.
So introducing a new parameter which allows any string as LOCATION
solves this problem and maybe a couple of others.

Change-Id: Ida54599049f69573d27f477c395f14ae0ec26c3c
(cherry picked from commit 78465631321bff442755070f4e3c18c171840dcf)

commit_message:
Fix bug to filter_scheduler

In https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/configuration/config.html#filter_scheduler.max_instances_per_host
refers to the "num_instances_filter" but that's the name
of the python module, not the actual filter.
So the config option help text should be updated to use
the actual filter names that would go in the 'enabled_filters'
option, not the python module in which those filters live.

Change-Id: Icf7e64ed45fa5013714d85ea22794f106d4e387c
Closes-bug: #1774676

commit_message:
Add health monitor API validation

The WSME package is not validating null/None fields correctly,
especially for Enum fields.
This patch strengthens the API validaton for health monitors.

It also removes an un-used status update method in the API
controllers.

Change-Id: I892dd81b166e9ab1a26bb80e8b0da1cb2e5c7482

[{'created': '2018-05-01 15:25:53.000000000', 'message': "VMAX driver - remove deprecated XML option

'cinder_dell_emc_config_file' was deprecated in Queens. We are now
removing all reference to it and all XML parsing. Now we rely solely
on the config tags in cinder.conf.

Closes-Bug: #1768273

Change-Id: If6f7c58f445dd813df7161cc6cd6dd84484e8a7e

commit_message:
VMAX driver - remove deprecated XML option

'cinder_dell_emc_config_file' was deprecated in Queens. We are now
removing all reference to it and all XML parsing. Now we rely solely
on the config tags in cinder.conf.

Closes-Bug: #1768273

Change-Id: If6f7c58f445dd813df7161cc6cd6dd84484e8a7e

commit_message:
Pass stack's name with variable overcloud_stack_name

Don't hardcode overcloud stack name to 'overcloud', but use variable
'overcloud_stack_name' that defaults to 'overcloud'.

Change-Id: I149e9cdd48791b0901535eb27889a5b840a1129b

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Deleting snapshot that is source of multiple volumes fails

Deleting a snapshot which is the source of multiple volumes fails with
the error: "The number of source and target devices must be equal". This
patch rectifies the issue by unlinking source and target volumes
individually where a single volume is a source of multiple targets.

Change-Id: I4b0c171051622f62aba1238c3b84d8a2c8bad6dc
Closes-bug: 1768047

subject: playbooks: roles: Drop explicit 'delegate_to' options
messages: [{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-06-21 09:07:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-06-22 07:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-23 10:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-21 09:07:55.000000000', 'message': "playbooks: roles: Drop explicit 'delegate_to' options

Bifrost instructions suggest to use 'connection: local' when calling any
of the roles. However, there are scenarios which the roles can be
delegated to some other host. The explicit 'delegate_to' statements
prevent us from doing that and they are not necessary if we use
'connection: local' anyway. As such we drop the explicit statements to
make the roles a bit more flexible.

Change-Id: Ifc983992125d203899d74b8bf997f9f58f528978
"}]
commit_message:
playbooks: roles: Drop explicit 'delegate_to' options

Bifrost instructions suggest to use 'connection: local' when calling any
of the roles. However, there are scenarios which the roles can be
delegated to some other host. The explicit 'delegate_to' statements
prevent us from doing that and they are not necessary if we use
'connection: local' anyway. As such we drop the explicit statements to
make the roles a bit more flexible.

Change-Id: Ifc983992125d203899d74b8bf997f9f58f528978

commit_message:
Make tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-oooq non-voting

We need it non voting so we can merge these 2 patches:
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576218/
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576225/

Indeed, the undercloud is being containerized by default so we need to
specify --use-instack for this job, but until this is done, let's make
the job non voting. We'll make it voting shortly after.

commit_message:
Load roles list from yaml instead of awk parsing

This change switches from using awk to parse the tripleo inventory
and loads the roles from yaml. In addition it places the commands
in a separate play available for all update/upgrade operations.

Change-Id: I736f22e834a8ecbbb076f04c3a5c7a7bbec852b5

commit_message:
Bump flask to past 1.0 (current 1.0.2)

Flask has move to 1.0 and is quite stable. New in 1.0+ is a lot
of beneficial test bits among other generally nice changes. In
moving Keystone to Flask, we would like to lean on the new test
capabilities in 1.0+

Change-Id: Ie0e8984c4c02a426eb1e7cbac8c5117aaaff5c40

messages:
[{'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-05-02 00:24:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-06-14 22:01:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(6 comments)

I like all of this, but... it feels like having hashes.pkl out-of-sync with the filesystem even after processing hashes.invalid is still a problem...'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-06-22 21:43:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 00:24:51.000000000', 'message': "Remove empty part dirs during ssync replication

When we're pushing data to a remote node using ssync, we end up
walking the entire partition's directory tree. We were already
removing reclaimable (i.e. old) tombstones and non-durable EC data
files plus their containing hash dirs, but we were leaving the suffix
dirs around for future removal, and we weren't cleaning up partition
dirs at all. Now we remove as much of the directory structure as we
can, even up to the partition dir, as soon as we observe that it's
empty.

Change-Id: I2849a757519a30684646f3a6f4467c21e9281707
Closes-Bug: 1706321
"}]
commit_message:
Remove empty part dirs during ssync replication

When we're pushing data to a remote node using ssync, we end up
walking the entire partition's directory tree. We were already
removing reclaimable (i.e. old) tombstones and non-durable EC data
files plus their containing hash dirs, but we were leaving the suffix
dirs around for future removal, and we weren't cleaning up partition
dirs at all. Now we remove as much of the directory structure as we
can, even up to the partition dir, as soon as we observe that it's
empty.

Change-Id: I2849a757519a30684646f3a6f4467c21e9281707
Closes-Bug: 1706321

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-21 18:30:31.000000000', 'message': "Add missing transaction in driver_controller.

All the operations related to router associations (add/del)
were executed under transactions, there was a case
'get_provider_for_router' doing add_resource_association
out of db transaction, luckily due to autocommit there were no
issues but this patch adds the missing transaction.

Closes-Bug: #1778118

Change-Id: Iaec9a40614c7e6ce1120e9fa7ef3a4fdb4d59963
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing transaction in driver_controller.

All the operations related to router associations (add/del)
were executed under transactions, there was a case
'get_provider_for_router' doing add_resource_association
out of db transaction, luckily due to autocommit there were no
issues but this patch adds the missing transaction.

Closes-Bug: #1778118

Change-Id: Iaec9a40614c7e6ce1120e9fa7ef3a4fdb4d59963

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000

Now that the v2.0 API has been removed, we don't have a reason to
include deployment instructions for two separate applications on
different ports.

Change-Id: Ic47074558e534d037e786cdd305974a76f90e6b1

commit_message:
Update integration jobs

This change aims to switch the puppet4 versions of the integration jobs
to only be run in <=Queens. The puppet5 integration jobs would become
voting and be run for >=Rocky.  Puppet 4 unit coverage still remains and
we'll have additional puppet 4 deployment coverage with the TripleO jobs
being added via If97e1f910c86a794edc79b6141b79f64ca4793cf.

Change-Id: I67dd58fac6957f599d26df6de0ee12b22916fd54

commit_message:
Fix Neutron-related return values on some list APIs

There are a handful of APIs in Neutron where instead of returning
an error code for a disallowed role, it returns an empty list. The
test cases for these APIs does not currently handle this.

Change-Id: Ice15b4d27dae72963281a31ba58fee1f373a9690

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-21 06:50:17.000000000', 'message': 'Storwize: self assign the SCSI lun id for volume attaching

Currently, the SCSI lun id is assigned by storage. But Storwize may
assigned the same SCSI lun id for different volumes on different i/o
groups. The wrong volume may be discovered with the same wwpn and same
lun id.

This patch reverts the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/360394/,
Storwize volume driver calculates an unused SCSI lun id and sends the
SCSI lun id to storage.
To avoid the problem of patch 360394,  this patch retries 3 times to
map volume to host if there is CMMVC5879E error.

Change-Id: I3d3c61f913ff7ec8d35c8105cecc1a51accd21e7
Closes-Bug: 1757922
(cherry picked from commit c42aba603b394789da1a09822510ee3b428c1069)
'}]
commit_message:
Storwize: self assign the SCSI lun id for volume attaching

Currently, the SCSI lun id is assigned by storage. But Storwize may
assigned the same SCSI lun id for different volumes on different i/o
groups. The wrong volume may be discovered with the same wwpn and same
lun id.

This patch reverts the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/360394/,
Storwize volume driver calculates an unused SCSI lun id and sends the
SCSI lun id to storage.
To avoid the problem of patch 360394,  this patch retries 3 times to
map volume to host if there is CMMVC5879E error.

Change-Id: I3d3c61f913ff7ec8d35c8105cecc1a51accd21e7
Closes-Bug: 1757922
(cherry picked from commit c42aba603b394789da1a09822510ee3b428c1069)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 17:11:20.000000000', 'message': 'remove announce and constraint jobs from pre-release pipeline

We do not want to send release announcement emails for
pre-releases (betas and alphas) because they are not complete.

We do not want to update the constraints list because pip requires
special instructions to use pre-releases and we do not use those
instructions in CI.

Change-Id: If1e608c7c2c7a8a775dcd61ca6fa3d64f3c16ae6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
remove announce and constraint jobs from pre-release pipeline

We do not want to send release announcement emails for
pre-releases (betas and alphas) because they are not complete.

We do not want to update the constraints list because pip requires
special instructions to use pre-releases and we do not use those
instructions in CI.

Change-Id: If1e608c7c2c7a8a775dcd61ca6fa3d64f3c16ae6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

sort() no longer being supported.

release from PyPI, thus causing gates everywhere to fail. Move the upper

Change-Id: Ie472630f03dd32bdab3b6aec202335c915d69671

commit_message:
Move upper constraint off deleted pycryptodomex release

The authors of pycryptodomex, in their wisdom, have deleted the 3.6.2
release from PyPI, thus causing gates everywhere to fail. Move the upper
constraint to the newly-released 3.6.3.

Change-Id: Ie472630f03dd32bdab3b6aec202335c915d69671

supported RPC versions < 4.0 since Kilo.  Given both this fact and the
absence of callers of this code today, it's safe to remove.

commit_message:
objects: Remove NUMATopologyLimits.obj_from_db_obj

Part of this code function was intended to support RPC versions < 3.40,
which haven't been supported since we bumped the minimum to 4.0 in Kilo.
However, there are no callers for the entire function today, so the
whole thing can be safely removed.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: Ie8f3d8ee701da6956f2a5706fb6ef3095e6518bd

commit_message:
Add fedora 28 support to kata runsh job

This refactors the kata runsh job a bit to push pre.yaml setup into a
role so that we can more easily include distro specific tasks. This
allows us to have differing ubuntu and fedora setup in a readable
manner.

Change-Id: I06029f49a81d0a4262c58e8f45a1414efa43d920

commit_message:
Implement discard for file backed memory

Add the discard flag to libvirt XML when supported by libvirt and qemu,
and when using file backed memory.

The discard flag causes qemu to discard allocated memory via calling
madvise with MADV_REMOVE when using file backed memory, to prevent
writing out dirty instance memory. This is a significant performance
improvement for shutting down instances that have recently written to
significant portions of their memory.

As qemu and libvirt do not guarantee the discard is run, this cannot be
used for security purposes.

Change-Id: Ia7cf4414feb335b3c2e863b4c8b4ff559b275c34
Implements: blueprint libvirt-file-backed-memory

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-21 06:48:31.000000000', 'message': 'Storwize: filter active wwpns for NPIV

Currently, both  active and offline wwpns are reported to the
fc_zone with NPIV feature.
Actually only the active wwpns should be reported.

This patch updates the cli lstargetportfc to filter the active wwpns.

Change-Id: I7b51b8ed12d1951a3e2356f88898a0779e858d41
Closes-Bug:  1756242
(cherry picked from commit c3469621177a6d915ca7f65fce975d5e5559e73c)
'}]
commit_message:
Storwize: filter active wwpns for NPIV

Currently, both  active and offline wwpns are reported to the
fc_zone with NPIV feature.
Actually only the active wwpns should be reported.

This patch updates the cli lstargetportfc to filter the active wwpns.

Change-Id: I7b51b8ed12d1951a3e2356f88898a0779e858d41
Closes-Bug:  1756242
(cherry picked from commit c3469621177a6d915ca7f65fce975d5e5559e73c)

commit_message:
Release python-cinderclient 3.6.1

This is just a bugfix release mainly to fix a backward
compatibility issue that had broken OSC.

Change-Id: Ieae641a4a3dcfd37b36f0aba3d0282ff7b0fffb0

subject: container-updater: Always report zero objects/bytes used for shards
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-06-21 20:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-06-21 22:20:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This makes sense to me. The objects aren't actually in .shards_<account>; that's just a namespace for the shard containers to live in."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-06-22 02:53:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-06-22 08:39:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2 Workflow-1

(1 comment)

I don't think this achieves what the commit message states. Manually testing with this I still see non-zero stats in the .shard_ account. I'll put together a test, but in meantime it would be better for this to not merge...it would be unhelpful for someone to grab this sha thinking it fixed something. If I'm wrong then we lost a few hours in the gate and I can live with the shame.

That said, I've never done -2 like this before so I'm not sure if it will stop this merging anyway."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-06-22 10:05:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-06-22 13:09:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-06-22 14:01:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Good catch! Thanks. I guess I'll let Sam take another look real quick."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-06-22 15:32:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

talking offline with Clay about this, are we sure this is the right answer to the problem vs just not counting the .shards account ? we were wondering what is happening with the other . accounts (reconciler, expirer).

I really doubt anybody cares if we change this, but might be worth pausing to consider if simply ignoring the .shards account is an alternative rather than obscuring information that someone might find useful one day??

But, I don't feel strongly about it, just a thought."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-06-22 16:14:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

adding my $0.02 - I briefly considered if the .shard_XXX databases need to exist AT ALL - much less if we should bother wasting cycles keeping them "updated" ...

Ultimately I seemed to imagine there's some non-zero value in keeping the .shard_XXX db's around for listings/hacking/back-tracking, but recognize double tracking bytes and objects is probably *close* to pointless (and maybe even wrong/bad) since the per-shard stats have to be kept in the root container...

Assuming it works, this solution might actually be a near-optimal compromise - which is almost surprising given our principles of design [1]:

    If you haven't argued about it, you don't have the right answer yet :)

1. https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst#swift-design-principles'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-06-22 16:19:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> the other . accounts (reconciler, expirer)

But the objects in those dot-accounts *actually correspond to objects in the account*. The .shards_ objects don't (or at any rate, shouldn't) actually exist -- even though you might see the object 'o' in '.shards_AUTH_a/c', you won't be able to do a GET on '.shards_AUTH_a/c/o' because the hash is all wrong.

In fact, you won't even be able to get the container listing if you have encryption enabled...

> if the .shard_XXX databases need to exist AT ALL

I have no strong opinion. I guess it might be handy in case there's a shard DB that the root lost all knowledge of but which some how hasn't gotten cleaned up yet?

> If you haven't argued about it, you don't have the right answer yet :)

Alternatively: maybe I'm just always right. (Except, y'know, for that bit where it didn't work *at all* and I needed Alistair to fix it for me.) ;-P"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-06-22 18:32:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks for catching that. It looks much better with .is_root_container() in there.'}]

commit_message:
container-updater: Always report zero objects/bytes used for shards

Otherwise, a sharded container AUTH_test/sharded will have its stats
included in the totals for both AUTH_test *and* .shards_AUTH_test

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistairncoles@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I7fa74e13347601c5f44fd7e6cf65656cc3ebc2c5

commit_message:
[Fullstack] Ensure connectivity to ext gw before agents restart

In TestHAL3Agent.test_ha_router_restart_agents_no_packet_lost
fullstack test we should first ensure that connection from external_vm
to router's external gateway is possible. If it's fine, we
can restart L3 agents and test if connectivity will not be broken.

Change-Id: I1f153c553cd2dfa846ce80c166e2a35acd9169a3
Related-Bug: #1776459

commit_message:
HPE3PAR: Fix pointing to backend in group failover

Issue: After group failover, subsequent operations
like attach & detach volume, which are part of that
failed over group points to primary backend instead
of secondary.

This patch fixes the above issue by setting up the
appropriate backend in case of subsequent operation
on volume, which are part of group which is failed
over.

Change-Id: I679b11317c91ad28cefdf995a8d6849dc71bc1c5
Closes-Bug: #1773069
(cherry picked from commit a433c19ef09c2f3e44dd3dd23fa1283c401aaf30)

commit_message:
Keep is_public usage backwards compatible

5a1513244caf7acbd41e181419bc8b62bf4bcaba added the ability to
filter by AZ, but it changed the existing behavior if is_public
was not specified. This adds handling to make sure we are still
consistent with the previous behavior.

Co-Authored-by: Alan Bishop <abishop@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5000aab092c1b434c8dc17bbe4b2d3d632f528c3
Closes-bug: #1778055

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Idd7629f2a051aadaf53b04a1b331b20d7fa690de

[{'created': '2018-06-07 16:46:09.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I1f24b2ecccdfd92e9c9304d1d57c75c6abe347a2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I1f24b2ecccdfd92e9c9304d1d57c75c6abe347a2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-15 15:39:22.000000000', 'message': '[OVS] Add mac-table-size to be set on each ovs bridge

By default number of MAC addresses which ovs stores in memory
is quite low - 2048.

Any eviction of a MAC learning table entry triggers revalidation.
Such revalidation is very costly so it cause high CPU usage by
ovs-vswitchd process.

To workaround this problem, higher value of mac-table-size
option can be set for bridge. Then this revalidation will happen
less often and CPU usage will be lower.
This patch adds config option for neutron-openvswitch-agent to allow
users tune this setting in bridges managed by agent.
By default this value is set to 50000 which should be enough for most
systems.

Change-Id: If628f52d75c2b5fec87ad61e0219b3286423468c
Closes-Bug: #1775797
(cherry picked from commit 1f8378e0ac4b8c3fc4670144e6efc51940d796ad)

commit_message:
[OVS] Add mac-table-size to be set on each ovs bridge

By default number of MAC addresses which ovs stores in memory
is quite low - 2048.

Any eviction of a MAC learning table entry triggers revalidation.
Such revalidation is very costly so it cause high CPU usage by
ovs-vswitchd process.

To workaround this problem, higher value of mac-table-size
option can be set for bridge. Then this revalidation will happen
less often and CPU usage will be lower.
This patch adds config option for neutron-openvswitch-agent to allow
users tune this setting in bridges managed by agent.
By default this value is set to 50000 which should be enough for most
systems.

Change-Id: If628f52d75c2b5fec87ad61e0219b3286423468c
Closes-Bug: #1775797
(cherry picked from commit 1f8378e0ac4b8c3fc4670144e6efc51940d796ad)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-21 05:18:06.000000000', 'message': 'Correct test register

This change corrects the name of a register used to cleanup containers
when running tests multiple times. While this register would not harm a
normal run, it does cause issues when re-running the tests due to the
fact the variable is used to determine if a container is removed and it
is undefined at this point.

Change-Id: I4e0c07c4047ccdde3becfb7345d2564bef0489da
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Correct test register

This change corrects the name of a register used to cleanup containers
when running tests multiple times. While this register would not harm a
normal run, it does cause issues when re-running the tests due to the
fact the variable is used to determine if a container is removed and it
is undefined at this point.

Change-Id: I4e0c07c4047ccdde3becfb7345d2564bef0489da
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-20 17:11:55.000000000', 'message': 'Append telemetry disable environment after docker.yaml

docker.yaml overrides the telemtry related resources. In case
telemetry is disabled during the initial deployment then they get
reenabled while running the stack output update. This change appends
the environment file used for disabling the telemtry services to the
stack output update script so the services are kept disabled during
upgrade.

Change-Id: I3b02408803f72e67404c8402f9196cb6153a9f91
Note:
'}]
commit_message:
Append telemetry disable environment after docker.yaml

docker.yaml overrides the telemtry related resources. In case
telemetry is disabled during the initial deployment then they get
reenabled while running the stack output update. This change appends
the environment file used for disabling the telemtry services to the
stack output update script so the services are kept disabled during
upgrade.

Change-Id: I3b02408803f72e67404c8402f9196cb6153a9f91
Note:

[{'created': '2018-06-22 19:32:32.000000000', 'message': 'Rename enginefacade async method into asynchronous

async is reserved keyword in python 3.7
we need to rename this method. keep async but make it deprecated
and introduce asynchronous. async will be deprecated in version 4.40.0

Closes-Bug: #1775866
Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <herveberaud.pro@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Rename enginefacade async method into asynchronous

async is reserved keyword in python 3.7
we need to rename this method. keep async but make it deprecated
and introduce asynchronous. async will be deprecated in version 4.40.0

Change-Id: Iede9d42e1c0775341956adf86a45905749dc2257
Closes-Bug: #1775866
Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <herveberaud.pro@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Mark Nimble Driver unsupported

The Nimble driver has not run 3rd Party CI
in more than 60 days.  This patch marks it
unsupported and it will be removed in Stein
if the 3rd Party CI Issues are not resolved.

Change-Id: I08f2266a8646da02761101b5468fbac236efdf62

commit_message:
revert https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573617

at least vmware-nsx with a DetachedInstanceError. This patch reverts
it. For more details see bug report

commit_message:
revert https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573617

Landing https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573617 appears to have broken
at least vmware-nsx with a DetachedInstanceError. This patch reverts
it. For more details see bug report

Change-Id: Ifb6bee190eaedaa6d58fdd0de641cd812f149ff2
Related-Bug: #1777908

commit_message:
Ensure _get_changed_synthetic_fields() return updatable fields

Currently _get_changed_synthetic_fields() does not guarantee
returned fields to be updatable. This patch adds this guarantee.

Change-Id: I123ae390bec489a931180a2e33f4bf7b1d51edb2
Closes-Bug: #1750353
(cherry picked from commit d5f27524819bc95530d0d5856782546fd02d65f8)

Currently _get_changed_synthetic_fields() does not guarantee

enable use-storyboard: true to set up the projects
in StoryBoard.

commit_message:
Remove dependency on EPEL

The EPEL repositories currently conflict with the RDO packages,
this commit drops it from openstack_hosts so new installs do not
get it.

Change-Id: I84c9c3e915207a79a54f613a382f92a1c1064196

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 17:05:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add a way to override base path when file driver is used

The goal is to be able to point the Gnocchi file driver directory
to an NFS share.

A new parameter GnocchiFileBasePath allows to customize
the bind mount to /var/lib/gnocchi.

Change-Id: I868a368161f4a529e5e7dc3593dc6862e3196247
(cherry picked from commit b3b027e731ddef17c857326409f680b9245516c4)
'}]
commit_message:
Add a way to override base path when file driver is used

The goal is to be able to point the Gnocchi file driver directory
to an NFS share.

A new parameter GnocchiFileBasePath allows to customize
the bind mount to /var/lib/gnocchi.

Change-Id: I868a368161f4a529e5e7dc3593dc6862e3196247
(cherry picked from commit b3b027e731ddef17c857326409f680b9245516c4)

commit_message:
Test nova server (VM) boot in overcloud job

We use the demo script from kolla ansible, init-runonce, to create
resources in the control plane to make it ready for booting a VM. We
then create a nova server, and wait for it to become active. We do not
currently test that the VM boots successfully by accessing it via SSH.

Change-Id: I61be554366565decd9f4ff7805a3969aa37da4b9

commit_message:
Stop setting package priorities

By setting priorities to repositories, we're messing up the ordering
of things and possibly making upgrades even more complicated.  Also,
the yum_repository module of Ansible allows managing it there, so
there is no need for an extra non-idempotent task to be added on top.

We're going to set all of them to the default 99.  If we need to make
any changes, we have the option to do that as well.

Depends-On: I9443f10e8c803599cbebfc2a53cb9c432bfa60d1
Change-Id: I2e42ef4022aaaa2e1cb9f461e63ce2e9e1f49511

commit_message:
Change BootSourceOverrideMode from BIOS to Legacy

Because this is what DMTF schema [1] requires.

1. https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/ComputerSystem.v1_5_0.json

Co-Authored-By: Richard G. Pioso <richard.pioso@dell.com>
Story: 2002635
Task: 22277
Change-Id: Ib158b2ea974a9022893a2fb3400be4017e3ff7b2

commit_message:
Adds support for Dell BOSS card RAID1 creation

The Dell BOSS card requires that 0 be passed for the RAID 1 size_gb for
the RAID creation to be successful.  This change causes the code to
treat a size of 0 as valid so the BOSS RAID 1 can be created.

Change-Id: Id149f6250318e6162a168d002671faa2b3a7989b
Task: #22082
Story: #2002536
Co-Authored-By: Digambar Patil <digambarpat@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add Dell PowerConnect switch support

PowerConnect switches do not support the dellos Ansible modules, since
they are based on DellOS version 4. This role uses the expect module to
perform simple switch configuration.

Change-Id: Icb59aaff75f9faf089423610fecb06598f75e35e
Story: 2002106
Task: 19784

commit_message:
Update for Python 3 compatibility

You can't sort() over keys() in Python 3. Use sorted(dict)
instead as it is a construct that works with both Python 2
and Python 3.

Change-Id: I6dd5b20eab00e17d9b4bc973cc62e78d9be062a1

subject: Fix trusted-image-certificate-id help text
messages:
[{'account_id': 7012, 'date': '2018-06-19 15:19:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-19 15:30:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7012, 'date': '2018-06-19 15:33:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-19 16:04:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-06-19 23:47:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7012, 'date': '2018-06-21 20:20:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7012, 'date': '2018-06-21 20:20:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2018-06-21 20:32:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The thing that bothers me about this approach is that we're erroring out because an environment variable is set, rather than simply ignoring the environment variable.  Of course, that's the way this was before, which is why I'm not down-voting, but it feels…unclean somehow."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-22 12:28:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> The thing that bothers me about this approach is that we're erroring out because an environment variable is set, rather than simply ignoring the environment variable. Of course, that's the way this was before, which is why I'm not down-voting, but it feels…unclean somehow.

I think the original idea behind the env var was to provide a way to pass trusted cert IDs w/o specifying them on the command line, I think for obfuscation reasons? I remember it being mikal's idea in Barcelona.

If we ignored the env var when the microversion isn't used, that could also be considered confusing that we're not honoring the env var. I tend to think we should be explicit about this stuff, and treat the env var like we do the CLI option and if it's there when you run boot/rebuild and you're at a lower version, it should be an explicit failure. Unsetting the variable temporarily (if you're actually using it) seems trivial. I assume, however, that people using this feature are going to code to this version and pin it in their scripts."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-22 12:29:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck volume group admin reset status'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-22 12:30:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Looks OK to me.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2018-06-22 13:04:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

OK, fair enough.'}]

commit_message:
Fix trusted-image-certificate-id help text

Fix the help text for nova boot to include that a parameter
is expected for trusted-image-certificate-id.  Also update the
UnsupportedAttribute error to mention the env variable to
reduce confusion.

Change-Id: Ic5980b610e5fd97d3a858a2a513e2863657f36c2

commit_message:
Add packages required for osprofiler

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.
these packages will provide deployers the ability to profile
a service on demand should they choose to enable the profile
functionality.

Change-Id: I9a2f8962e303ff96415591b6791a46b002b84e92
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add packages required for osprofiler

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.
these packages will provide deployers the ability to profile
a service on demand should they choose to enable the profile
functionality.

Change-Id: I351b2ae03b90397e46d46ef80007b02106e9bb96
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
rename swob.str_from_wsgi -> swob.wsgi_to_str

This way we have wsgi_to_str and str_to_wsgi; this makes it easier to
read and to tab-complete than having str_from_wsgi and str_to_wsgi
where the important part is the middle word.

Change-Id: Ibab626355d8730dcd99c9e5720186ce77faf7ab8

The pylint target was switched to python3, but I didn't realize
that it's not really working. This change should make lintstack.py
compatible with Python 3.

Related note: we should find a unified solution for all repositories
which have a local copy of lintstack.py/lintstack.sh instead of
duplicating this code over and over.

Change-Id: I5727e33f8ac40347e47e4f5f4e64579897a66f6f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix lintstack.py with Python3

The pylint target was switched to python3, but I didn't realize
that it's not really working. This change should make lintstack.py
compatible with Python 3.

Related note: we should find a unified solution for all repositories
which have a local copy of lintstack.py/lintstack.sh instead of
duplicating this code over and over.

Change-Id: I5727e33f8ac40347e47e4f5f4e64579897a66f6f

Change-Id: I6a56e1edf277c5652a876658f8cfbb5550a73ada
Story: 2002617
"}, {'created': '2018-06-19 19:19:08.000000000', 'message': "Use register_error_handler to register make_json_error

error_handler_spec[None] doesn't exist by default in flask
versions >= 1.0. It doesn't appear to be the right way to

commit_message:
Use register_error_handler to register make_json_error

error_handler_spec[None] doesn't exist by default in flask
versions >= 1.0. It doesn't appear to be the right way to
register an error handler anyway, assuming that's what it is
doing. Use register_error_handler instead.

Change-Id: I6a56e1edf277c5652a876658f8cfbb5550a73ada
Story: 2002617
Task: 22246

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 22:21:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add check if neutron "binding-extended" extension is available

Per the API definition in I431be79975f6fc371822038ed4acdf02e7b8e99b,
this adds a method to allow checking if neutron has the
"Port Bindings Extended" extension available, which allows nova
to binding a port to multiple hosts at the same time, like during
live migration where the source host has the active port binding
and once we complete the live migration to the destination host,
the active port binding is switched to the destination host.

Later patches will build on this to detect when a compute service
is can support this type of operation during live migration.

Part of blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

Change-Id: Iad7a6adc779518575f33eb689c398f8ace96782b

Part of blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

commit_message:
Add check if neutron "binding-extended" extension is available

Per the API definition in I431be79975f6fc371822038ed4acdf02e7b8e99b,
this adds a method to allow checking if neutron has the
"Port Bindings Extended" extension available, which allows nova
to bind a port to multiple hosts at the same time, like during
live migration where the source host has the active port binding
and once we complete the live migration to the destination host,
the active port binding is switched to the destination host.

Later patches will build on this to detect when a compute service
can support this type of operation during live migration.

Part of blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

Change-Id: Iad7a6adc779518575f33eb689c398f8ace96782b

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.

commit_message:
Do not run nic template conversion on default tht location

When the nic templates are stored under /usr/share/openstack-
tripleo-heat-templates there's no need to run the nic conversion
script as they should already be updated in the tht package.

Depends-On: I50cc3e824020320c66ad5f04f434f20674de358e

Change-Id: I765a80a23267585bdbcc1450b071493d164a9089
(cherry picked from commit 85eac0b7f404e435f72f6bf5d09e164fc5a305e0)

In ansible 2.5 the way files are generated changes meaning that --diff
mode will stop working, and generate an error instead. Pending a better
solution, we should remove --diff mode.

Change-Id: I0d9b7baf08be00b978b8198f95db8962e7fa7787
'}]
commit_message:
Remove --diff mode support

In ansible 2.5 the way files are generated changes meaning that --diff
mode will stop working, and generate an error instead. Pending a better
solution, we should remove --diff mode.

Change-Id: I0d9b7baf08be00b978b8198f95db8962e7fa7787

[{'created': '2018-06-18 17:28:33.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Add a non-voting neutron-lib job

This job will allow us to test neutron patch against neutron-lib
master. A common scenario is there is a neutron patch A that
depends on neutron-lib patch B. In before, we don't know if patch
A will work with patch B until patch B is merged and releases.
The new job can address this scenario.

Change-Id: I36f1a5cb94ae2e51971ea2599011c4ff8019b905
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Add a non-voting neutron-lib job

This job will allow us to test neutron patch against neutron-lib
master. A common scenario is there is a neutron patch A that
depends on neutron-lib patch B. In before, we don't know if patch
A will work with patch B until patch B is merged and releases.
The new job can address this scenario.

Change-Id: I36f1a5cb94ae2e51971ea2599011c4ff8019b905

Thanks Yossi,

I addressed your comments. For the other points you comment, I expect to annotate them at the same place where currently happens (vif handler) and I plan to create the KuryrPort CRD objects at the same point. Regarding the HA, at least for the Active/Passive it should be completely transparent'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-06-21 15:40:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-06-22 13:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-06-22 13:42:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Support Ansible 2.5

Raises the maximum Ansible version in requirements.txt to Ansible 2.5.x
for both kayobe and kolla ansible.

Also removes the hack to use a patched parted module for ceph block
device management, as Ansible 2.4 contains the required fix.

Change-Id: I0d2f564eb1ddb63b07829d6f0d918af26887db97
Story: 2001649
Task: 6668

commit_message:
Remove python-crypto and use in-repo GPG keys

We don't need python cryptography bindings in order to deploy a Galera
server therefore drop it from our dependencies.  It also is no longer
used inside OpenStack world for lack of security.

Also, we make remote network hits to get the GPG keys which are quite
unreliable so let's store them inside the role and use them.

Change-Id: I9443f10e8c803599cbebfc2a53cb9c432bfa60d1

[{'created': '2018-06-09 01:25:34.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I9aaae4949e2cf6c8a33fb6fbf8be15e1d09cce44

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I9aaae4949e2cf6c8a33fb6fbf8be15e1d09cce44

commit_message:
Pass resolved pybasedir to pick function

A change in puppet function pick, break variable expansion
inside strings, this change just expand it before passing it.

Related puppet PR https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-stdlib/pull/890.

Change-Id: Ic5cbbced85b083b15da1dbd28fb2f045f0954494
Closes-Bug: 1778201

commit_message:
Add import inventory command & api

This undoes a part of a prior checkin
(Ib250c5de8e00818b41c1a4539aba8c165a4ad2e2) that added an inventory
import option to the "config reset" command. That turned out to
be too limiting, so this is changing config reset back to the way it
was and adds a new import inventory command. This command
could be augmented in the future to add the ability to import
group variables, host variables or passwords from files.

Change-Id: If930ab19f9c666d9d025c63cf10c1fad758a7247
Related-to: Ib250c5de8e00818b41c1a4539aba8c165a4ad2e2

subject: Add missing 'update_tasks' to the OVN dbs pacemaker service
messages: [{'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2018-06-18 10:23:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-06-18 10:40:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-06-22 09:39:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-18 10:23:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing 'update_tasks' to the OVN dbs pacemaker service

Presently the OVN dbs pacemaker service file doesn't include the update_tasks
section and it neither tags the docker image to be used with pcmklatest.
Because of which when a minor update is run, the latest docker image for
ovn-dbs-bundle is never pulled.

This patch addresses these issue. It does 3 things

1. It adds update_tasks section similar to other pacemaker bundle services.
It adds additional few steps in step 5 (which is not the case with other
pacemaker bundle services) to update the ovn bundle service to use the
image tagged with pcmklatest if it not yet using. These additional steps
are required for OVN deployments deployed before this patch and wants to
do a minor stack update.

2. It adds the required tasks in "upgrade_tasks" section similar to
other pacemaker bundle services.

3. Adds docker_config step to tag the image with pcmklatest tag.

Change-Id: Idbda3bedff57376b74269ab3470d2324b804ffd4
Closes-bug: #1775686
(cherry picked from commit c90e0a7197e5f84d4f0cf1e284866eba48c093d4)
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing 'update_tasks' to the OVN dbs pacemaker service

Presently the OVN dbs pacemaker service file doesn't include the update_tasks
section and it neither tags the docker image to be used with pcmklatest.
Because of which when a minor update is run, the latest docker image for
ovn-dbs-bundle is never pulled.

This patch addresses these issue. It does 3 things

1. It adds update_tasks section similar to other pacemaker bundle services.
It adds additional few steps in step 5 (which is not the case with other
pacemaker bundle services) to update the ovn bundle service to use the
image tagged with pcmklatest if it not yet using. These additional steps
are required for OVN deployments deployed before this patch and wants to
do a minor stack update.

2. It adds the required tasks in "upgrade_tasks" section similar to
other pacemaker bundle services.

3. Adds docker_config step to tag the image with pcmklatest tag.

Change-Id: Idbda3bedff57376b74269ab3470d2324b804ffd4
Closes-bug: #1775686
(cherry picked from commit c90e0a7197e5f84d4f0cf1e284866eba48c093d4)

exported through OS_* variables.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/569449/1/ : SUCCESS in 2h 27m 03s'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-05-20 22:04:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think this will land on queens so therefore isn't appropriate for pike"}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-05-21 22:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I don't think this will land on queens so therefore isn't
 > appropriate for pike

In some form, this change *should* land for Pike, too; see the comment on the Queens change.  In short: Yet another new CVE (related to Spectre/Meltdown) was discovered:

    "Speculative Store Buffer Bypass"[0][1][2]

To mitigate this new CVE, we now need to expose yet another Intel CPU flag to the guest -- 'ssbd' ("Speculative Store Bypass Disable")

Instead of adding yet another new flag to the white list, we'll simply lift the restriction.

[0] https://bugs.chromium.org/p/project-zero/issues/detail?id=1528
[1] https://access.redhat.com/security/vulnerabilities/ssbd 
[2] https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-3639'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-22 12:20:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-18 15:46:24.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Lift the restriction of choices for `cpu_model_extra_flags`

Commit 6b601b7 (libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature flags)
added support for allowing to specify individual CPU feature flags, but
restricted the options only to "PCID" (refer to its commit message for
why).

In this change we lift the restriction of choices, and allow to specify
multiple CPU feature flags for all three CPU modes for the libvirt
driver: 'custom', 'host-model', and 'host-passthrough'.

For example:

     [libvirt]
     cpu_mode = custom
     cpu_model = IvyBridge
     cpu_model_extra_flags = pcid, vmx, pdpe1gb

This will allow additional use cases such as:

  - Ability to use 1GB huge pages with models that don't provide it
    (such as Intel "Haswell" variants) as one use case for extra flags:

        cpu_mode = custom
        cpu_model = Haswell-noTSX-IBRS
        cpu_model_extra_flags = pdpe1gb

  - Nested Virtualization -- an operator can specify the Intel 'vmx' (or
    AMD 'svm') flags for the level-1 Nova guest CPU models.  (Assuming
    the 'nested' flag is enabled on the level-0 / bare-metal kernel.)

(A future Nova patch will also allow ability to remove CPU flags.)

Closes-Bug: #1750829
Change-Id: I9a862619f379057bb48cb85a84dfc50d763030a6
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit cc27a2007f314df18812d54a087f6192d6aed3fb)
(cherry picked from commit 088ff533ce0fe10052a325c3d31ffe88ee825b1f)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Lift the restriction of choices for `cpu_model_extra_flags`

Commit 6b601b7 (libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature flags)
added support for allowing to specify individual CPU feature flags, but
restricted the options only to "PCID" (refer to its commit message for
why).

In this change we lift the restriction of choices, and allow to specify
multiple CPU feature flags for all three CPU modes for the libvirt
driver: 'custom', 'host-model', and 'host-passthrough'.

For example:

     [libvirt]
     cpu_mode = custom
     cpu_model = IvyBridge
     cpu_model_extra_flags = pcid, vmx, pdpe1gb

This will allow additional use cases such as:

  - Ability to use 1GB huge pages with models that don't provide it
    (such as Intel "Haswell" variants) as one use case for extra flags:

        cpu_mode = custom
        cpu_model = Haswell-noTSX-IBRS
        cpu_model_extra_flags = pdpe1gb

  - Nested Virtualization -- an operator can specify the Intel 'vmx' (or
    AMD 'svm') flags for the level-1 Nova guest CPU models.  (Assuming
    the 'nested' flag is enabled on the level-0 / bare-metal kernel.)

(A future Nova patch will also allow ability to remove CPU flags.)

Closes-Bug: #1750829
Change-Id: I9a862619f379057bb48cb85a84dfc50d763030a6
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit cc27a2007f314df18812d54a087f6192d6aed3fb)
(cherry picked from commit 088ff533ce0fe10052a325c3d31ffe88ee825b1f)

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Idac327ef35d8317c6e9ae838f2d88c4b5b926606

Move boot-related code to boot_mode_utils.py

This change collects boot-relalated functions into
the `boot_mode_utils.py` module to improve code clarity.

commit_message:
Devstack deployment - handle LoadBalancer creation failure

During Devstack deployment a Load Balancer is created
to allows pods that need access to Kubernetes API  to talk
to the K8s API service.
In case of Load Balancer's 'provisioning_status' not set to
'ACTIVE' for any reason the deployment is stuck forever,
 this patch adds maximum timeout for LoadBalancer's status verification.

Change-Id: I735b87ea3b243421fb83189b6de7df8ce17cbf7c
Closes-Bug: 1760885
(cherry picked from commit 79a18d311830000bb0eaa2c0a1d153baa1f9c637)

question: What happens for existing deployments which use the hybrid iptable driver, especially when ovs-agent is restarted? This is the important point we need to check in this review. Could you check it?'}, {'account_id': 5109, 'date': '2018-01-30 16:34:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> question: What happens for existing deployments which use the
 > hybrid iptable driver, especially when ovs-agent is restarted? This
 > is the important point we need to check in this review. Could you
 > check it?

Hello Akihiro,

The ovs-agent re-loads the assigned CT Zones from Iptables configuration 
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/agent/linux/ip_conntrack.py#L126

But is the vm is destroyed and recreated, this change will make sure that new CT Zones are in the correct Zone range (>=4097)

Thanks

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-26 06:06:15.000000000', 'message': 'This patch changes the CT zone allocation range

SG with hybrid-iptables driver uses per port conntrack zones.
FWaaS port security uses per network conntrack zones based on
local vlans assigned by ovs l2 agent.

In case both SG iptables-hybrid driver and FWaaS port security is enabled,
There is a posibility of iptables-hybrid  and OVS based FWaaS driver
allocating overlapping zone and creating security holes.

This patch changes the zone allocation range for iptables and
hybrid_iptables driver to  4097 - 65535. While OVS can based
port security driver can use zones base on local vlan range 1 - 4096

Change-Id: I4d51637ed1de8fe85b4982a03410d4a3f637ea3f

commit_message:
This patch changes the CT zone allocation range

SG with hybrid-iptables driver uses per port conntrack zones.
FWaaS port security uses per network conntrack zones based on
local vlans assigned by ovs l2 agent.

In case both SG iptables-hybrid driver and FWaaS port security is enabled,
there is a posibility of iptables-hybrid  and OVS based FWaaS driver
allocating overlapping zone and creating security holes.

This patch changes the zone allocation range for iptables and
hybrid_iptables driver to  4097 - 65535. While OVS based
port security driver can use zones based on local vlan range 1 - 4096

Closes-Bug: #1745642
Change-Id: I4d51637ed1de8fe85b4982a03410d4a3f637ea3f

commit_message:
Add timeout to the wait_for method in plugin.sh

Avoid long wait for tasks that should end quickly.
The timeout default is 5 minutes (300 seconds), but may be configured in
local.conf by defining KURYR_WAIT_TIMEOUT to any other value (seconds)

Change-Id: I86b2a436085452ef74104750db29c14b9092b7ae
(cherry picked from commit 727608a92effd02ca82d3df2e962e38db04bf377)

commit_message:
add cloud-init workaround

The version of cloud-init included with CentOS7.5 (0.7.9-24)
fails to assign an IP address on VLAN subinterfaces. This
workaround upgrades cloud-init to 18.2 using a private
repository.

Story: 2002610
Task: 22229
Change-Id: Idc570b9ca7558dfd42246c74b1ec0331011d692f

commit_message:
Port rally plugins to use proper modules

Sometime ago, all OpenStack related stuff moved from the main repository
to the separate one - https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack .
All further development and maintance will be done only in a new
repository. As for first major release, the structure is not changed, so
only imports should be changed.

Depends-On: I3446ccd5a36cb686282e85a9ea210d1723da1fef
Change-Id: Ied6b0693ba2e050b0d5f5bae91fed25891ae9882

commit_message:
HPE3PAR: Fix pointing to backend in group failover

Issue: After group failover, subsequent operations
like attach & detach volume, which are part of that
failed over group points to primary backend instead
of secondary.

This patch fixes the above issue by setting up the
appropriate backend in case of subsequent operation
on volume, which are part of group which is failed
over.

Change-Id: I679b11317c91ad28cefdf995a8d6849dc71bc1c5
Closes-Bug: #1773069

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-11 13:54:50.000000000', 'message': "Support virtualenv installation in baremetal role

Installing python packages directly to the system site-packages can
cause various problems, in particular when pip overwrites a system
package. Python virtualenvs are one solution to this issue, as they
allow python packages to be installed in an isolated environment.

This change adds support to the baremetal role for installing python
dependencies in a virtualenv. Typically we will need to enable use of
system site-packages from within this virtualenv, to support the use of
modules such as yum, apt, and selinux, which are not available on PyPI.

The path to the virtualenv is configured via the 'virtualenv' variable,
and access to site-packages is controlled via
'virtualenv_site_packages'.

When executing other kolla-ansible commands, the variable
'ansible_python_interpreter' should be set to the python interpreter
installed in 'virtualenv'. Note that this variable cannot be templated.

Change-Id: I0741923065246f9c5b168059fcd66504f2753c41
Related-Bug: #1731026

commit_message:
Support virtualenv installation in baremetal role

Installing python packages directly to the system site-packages can
cause various problems, in particular when pip overwrites a system
package. Python virtualenvs are one solution to this issue, as they
allow python packages to be installed in an isolated environment.

This change adds support to the baremetal role for installing python
dependencies in a virtualenv. Typically we will need to enable use of
system site-packages from within this virtualenv, to support the use of
modules such as yum, apt, and selinux, which are not available on PyPI.

The path to the virtualenv is configured via the 'virtualenv' variable,
and access to site-packages is controlled via
'virtualenv_site_packages'.

When executing other kolla-ansible commands, the variable
'ansible_python_interpreter' should be set to the python interpreter
installed in 'virtualenv'. Note that this variable cannot be templated.

Change-Id: I0741923065246f9c5b168059fcd66504f2753c41
Related-Bug: #1731026
