commit_message:
Declare django lower bound

After 7e91070789187d9e6b5ac2b57ca755504e058e32 in openstack/requirements
repo, all entries in project requirements.txt must have lower bound
although we don't track lower bound in global-requirements.txt.
This commit re-adds Django lower bound.

Change-Id: I065e1bd904975f10bdcaacef7b0ad1336915492a

commit_message:
Enable iPXE boot in ironic

a new variable, kolla_enable_ironic_ipxe is added to control whether or not
iPXE is used as the network boot program in ironic. You can set this is in
etc/kayobe/kolla.yml, e.g:

  kolla_enable_ironic_ipxe: True

Change-Id: I7da15e7ceea580e5b7bee7fc732351cbec666f4c
Story: 2001949
Task: 15068
Depends-On: I08fca1864a00afb768494406c49e968920c83ae7

commit_message:
Add timeout to the wait_for method in plugin.sh

Avoid long wait for tasks that should end quickly.
The timeout default is 5 minutes (300 seconds), but may be configured in
local.conf by defining KURYR_WAIT_TIMEOUT to any other value (seconds)

Change-Id: I86b2a436085452ef74104750db29c14b9092b7ae

[{'created': '2018-04-17 02:37:03.000000000', 'message': "WIP: PCPU, VCPU: Add respective conf options

This patch adds below two conf options under 'compute' section:

    [compute]
    cpu_dedicated_set
    cpu_shared_set

These CONF options will store a pinset string that indicates the
physical processors that should be used for the 'PCPU' and 'VCPU'
resource requests, respectively.

NOTE:
These configuration options are unused until we merge the code that
reads them. Respective 'releasenote' with 'how to use' information
will be added in the same patch.

Partially Implements: blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: Id6202390727ab7425e9690de824d364ea090ab55

    [compute]

This CONF option will store a pinset string that indicates the

commit_message:
PCPU: Add respective conf options

This patch adds below conf options under 'compute' section:

    [compute]
    cpu_dedicated_set

This CONF option will store a pinset string that indicates the
physical processors that should be used for the assignment of
dedicated 'PCPU' resources to the guest VM.

NOTE:
As per the spec and blueprint the implementation should add two
CONF options ``cpu_dedicated_set`` and ``cpu_shared_set`` but
the parallel spec implemented [1] has added the ``cpu_shared_set``
already. So this patch only concentrates on adding
``cpu_dedicated_set``.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/rocky/approved/libvirt-emulator-threads-policy.html
Partially Implements: blueprint cpu-resources
Change-Id: Id6202390727ab7425e9690de824d364ea090ab55

commit_message:
Adds ceilometer-upgrade task

Run ceilometer-upgrade task  post ceiloemeter installation
to create the resources in gnocchi

Change-Id: I232086142ed7d494ffd49aba16c9768470a06bd5
Implements: Additonal step to run ceilometer-upgrade during ceilometer-post-install tasks
Closes-Bug:: 1737096
(cherry picked from commit ca7cf70eafeb3be784aac9fb8ac21166fd4dbcd2)

commit_message:
Fix create mongodb cluster error in multi-azs env

When I use "trove cluster-create cluster1 mongodb 3.2.10
--instance "flavor=7,volume=5,nic='net-id=81f6d0f2-274f-4c12-ad55-01c2db15dec7',availability_zone=nova"
--instance "flavor=7,volume=5,nic='net-id=81f6d0f2-274f-4c12-ad55-01c2db15dec7',availability_zone=nova"
--instance "flavor=7,volume=5,nic='net-id=81f6d0f2-274f-4c12-ad55-01c2db15dec7',availability_zone=nova""
to create a mongodb cluster in an environment that has an
availability_zone for hyperv, it cause error.

Change-Id: Ie64a0f14e7dfa69f97ac22bc33d61e2ca554b1cd
Closes-bug: #1759102

I've added Hamdy to clear up the issue as I thought this was supposed to be an integer."}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-06-05 20:34:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I've added Hamdy to clear up the issue as I thought this was
 > supposed to be an integer.
@Brain the reason we need this as a string is because of ironic use case see https://github.com/openstack/ironic/commit/228a2a7885e1b04d4180fe8daa2992884decaf6d. This is the reason we posted this fix in the first place, but while I review hamdy code I missed it that ironic is putting '61' and not 61. maybe we should support both.
byt the way both hamdy and lenny belong to my team so the change is aligned with them"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-06-05 20:49:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Moshe - understood.  I think it's maybe better to just add str(DHCP_OPT_CLIENT_ID_NUM) to the set in the two places in the dhcp agent code, that way it can support either.  That's assuming it can be specified as either in the API."}, {'account_id': 14807, 'date': '2018-06-06 07:14:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-06-06 10:34:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Allow DHCP_OPT_CLIENT_ID_NUM to be string

Commit [1] added DHCP_OPT_CLIENT_ID_NUM as an integer
but sometimes it is passed as a string.  Support both.

[1] I9728354d5f9e08a0dc23900b2bc22b4a0aedb737

Change-Id: I2ca4c4538c4b971044f4264a18421cf08dbe4be6

commit_message:
Specify compute node to run the containers

Support specify the compute node to run the containers by availability_host
parameter.

Related bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/zun/+bug/1764236

Change-Id: I3aa2055377311f91edfa490802f49c56c0fee577

This patch updates the lower constraints of heat-translator

commit_message:
Update lower constraints for heat-translator 1.1.0

Tacker requires a new version '1.1.0' of heat-translator to
support a new feature [1] and fix a bug [2].

This patch updates the lower constraints of heat-translator
for the same.

1. https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/vdu-affinity-policy
2. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523021/

Change-Id: Ia7933b0f4135b628e981783b13efadb4fd4289d8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 03:15:15.000000000', 'message': "Clear selections for table view

Item selections on table view for batch actions does not be cleared
after execution of actions.
This patch ensures to clear item selections by emitting 'hzTable:clearSelection'
event.

Change-Id: I8860a135ad3ca9f0c7d80229b237519dec42b2f7
Closes-Bug: #1777545
"}]
commit_message:
Clear selections for table view

Item selections on table view for batch actions does not be cleared
after execution of actions.
This patch ensures to clear item selections by emitting 'hzTable:clearSelection'
event.

Change-Id: I8860a135ad3ca9f0c7d80229b237519dec42b2f7
Closes-Bug: #1777545

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-21 23:05:53.000000000', 'message': 'Add fedora vexxhost flavor for Kata

The current plan for Kata is to show that rough parity with their
existing/previous CI works under Zuul and have them provide feedback on
that via third party check jobs run against kata-containers/runtime. If
this works out and Kata wants to move forward we will need to deploy
"production" Zuul CI for them in a new Zuul tenant.

Currently we only have Ubuntu Xenial testing for them, but they also
have Fedora and CentOS testing. Add a Fedora label to continue pushing
on this. Followup should be to add CentOS once Fedora is working, then
start commenting on the runtime repo.

Change-Id: Ie269c8a233ae4de8a3fe43c4f7d5ff11e1db1c82
'}]
commit_message:
Add fedora vexxhost flavor for Kata

The current plan for Kata is to show that rough parity with their
existing/previous CI works under Zuul and have them provide feedback on
that via third party check jobs run against kata-containers/runtime. If
this works out and Kata wants to move forward we will need to deploy
"production" Zuul CI for them in a new Zuul tenant.

Currently we only have Ubuntu Xenial testing for them, but they also
have Fedora and CentOS testing. Add a Fedora label to continue pushing
on this. Followup should be to add CentOS once Fedora is working, then
start commenting on the runtime repo.

Change-Id: Ie269c8a233ae4de8a3fe43c4f7d5ff11e1db1c82

subject: Adds a OpenStack endpoint information to sona_config
messages:
[{'account_id': 26288, 'date': '2018-06-22 04:45:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-22 04:45:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 25575, 'date': '2018-06-22 04:56:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28180, 'date': '2018-06-22 04:57:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25575, 'date': '2018-06-22 04:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Update role to accomodate testing change

The nspawn container create role needs to have it's tests updated
because local connections that are delegated to remove containers no
longer works as it once did. This change simply uses the all_containers
group and the known connection plugin to ensure we're able to run the
same tests.

Depends-On: Iab422c718d789ef13b8ec55938fdb7e73e40061b
Change-Id: I4d845ef065745e93651ac1853c05747bf26d6631
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

CONF file structure refactor

This is the openstack governance goal that the config files should
be merged into one folder to make the code to be better understood
and managed.

commit_message:
Fix amphora failover flow documentation

The amphora failover flow documentation diagram is only showing the
spares pool failover flow. This patch fixes the flow documentation to
show a full failover flow again.

commit_message:
Allow Kolla Ceph to deploy bluestore OSD with 4 partitions

Enhance the deployment of Kolla-Ceph bluestore OSD.

Deploy bluestore OSD including up to 4 partitions:
* one partition is for bluestore OSD information
* one partition is for bluestore block
* one partition is for bluestore block.wal
* one partition is for bluestore block.db

Deploy bluestore OSD deployment with LOOP devices.

Partially-Implements: blueprint kolla-ceph-bluestore

Change-Id: I00eaa600a5e9ad4c1ebca2eeb523bca3d7a25128
Signed-off-by: tone.zhang <tone.zhang@arm.com>

commit_message:
Clear selections for table view

Item selections on table view for batch actions does not be cleared
after execution of actions.
This patch ensures to clear item selections by emitting 'hzTable:clearSelection'
event.

Change-Id: Ieb2aad733ef06a16183f9c7c1f05a6e32659d67b
Closes-Bug: #1777545

commit_message:
Clear selections for table view

Item selections on table view for batch actions does not be cleared
after execution of actions.
This patch ensures to clear item selections by emitting 'hzTable:clearSelection'
event.

Change-Id: I149a917c39d2892d243dd9fd5b245a8601b43052
Closes-Bug: #1777545

Unblock gate

Fixes to eliminate autodoc errors coming with sphinx upgrade.

Increase nova service timeout

Change-Id: Id7c8dcb82b3529afdc22957239870e2a27cc6e1b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-30 09:53:06.000000000', 'message': "VMAX driver - Incorrect service level reporting

'Optimized' is being reported as a service level option for VMAX
All-Flash arrays, in the get_pools output, and it can be assigned as
the default pool if there is no service level assigned to a volume type.
This can cause errors, as Optimized is not a recognized service level on
All Flash arrays. This patch rectifies the issue.

Change-Id: I9365ae3b923eeb92ac00023b7040e934b6e2df57
Closes-bug: 1766633

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Incorrect service level reporting

'Optimized' is being reported as a service level option for VMAX
All-Flash arrays, in the get_pools output, and it can be assigned as
the default pool if there is no service level assigned to a volume type.
This can cause errors, as Optimized is not a recognized service level on
All Flash arrays. This patch rectifies the issue.

Change-Id: I9365ae3b923eeb92ac00023b7040e934b6e2df57
Closes-bug: 1766633

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Ubuntu 18.04 ships 3.6.5; may as well have a testenv handy for it.

Change-Id: Ibea05bc879685fab148cde1b19510e83f0639f5d

commit_message:
VMAX driver and docs - change san_rest_port to san_api_port

This is part of the effort to consolidate and eliminate duplicate
configuration tags. san_rest_port will be deprecated in this
release and replaced by san_api_port in the next.

Change-Id: I5051e39c3bf45a3a4903e94c1597a142321a77e4
Closes-Bug: #1758010

commit_message:
Exclude dulwich 0.19.3 from global requirements

dulwich 0.19.3 is broken due to [1],
we need to exclude this specific version
to avoid problems.

If we use this version will produce this kind of errors:

UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode
byte 0xc4 in position 48: ordinal not in range(128)

Because there are unicode characters in the setup.cfg
for this version.

[1]:  https://github.com/dulwich/dulwich/commit/1b6509fa3dbd05c458990b71fadff91af095f733

Depends-On: Icabb56b9c6b2d99d78a7e1a77f8fe7a4ea6fa0c8
Change-Id: I1f80bc81917f768e1ecb55aebdd5fc84e056b229

commit_message:
Remove network info stubbing in functional test

The ProviderUsageBaseTestCase stubs out lot of the port binding
behavior of nova to make the test pass with empty networks list.
Since API microversion 2.37 nova allows passing 'none' as the networks
parameter of server create to signal that no networking is needed for
the instance.

This patch proposes to use networks='none' instead of stubbing the port
binding code path. This way later patches can introduce tests where
the port binding code path is also verified.

In separate future patches the usage of
nova.tests.unit.fake_network.set_stub_network_methods can be eliminated
from the functional tests.

Change-Id: Iacff300b117a8ed629b92e53a6fe0651719eeaa9

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If27b1960674af44a4de7af412550321d74f05af6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Conditionally Enable Nuage VRS

Using this change, users can conditionally enable and
configure Nuage VRS on Overcloud nodes

In Pike, as neutron-server is still running as a service on
the hypervisor, this approach will configure VRS which is also
running on the hypervisor.

This review is meant for Pike and earlier releases only.

Change-Id: Ib563842f182383a9cec49ee57943039346098b53
Depends-On: I6a996a6b9e1b2d4c74e25e2582699eb9e023093a
Closes-Bug: 1776998

where things are UTF8 checked. Many of these PY3 convertion problems
seem to be around mixing binary and unicode strings.
The tests currently pass on this patchset, however, they were more
just drive by fixing issues. Maybe a smarter way is to look at the
number of string changes and refactor/rework things to work better
in PY3, not just hack to get things working.

So setting to WIP state.

'}]
commit_message:
py3: convert common/constraints

Not 100% sure about some of these changes. Might have to think about
where things are UTF8 checked. Many of these PY3 convertion problems
seem to be around mixing binary and unicode strings.
The tests currently pass on this patchset, however, they were more
just drive by fixing issues. Maybe a smarter way is to look at the
number of string changes and refactor/rework things to work better
in PY3, not just hack to get things working.

So setting to WIP state.

Change-Id: I089e20c9a405972a58ab8af3a6ce8d61bf2e130d

[{'created': '2018-06-18 20:57:54.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify placement DB schema migration

This just clarifies in the release note for the optional
placement database that the database itself is not created
when running "nova-manage api_db sync", but rather the
database schema is created. This is important since a
non-trivial number of people over the years have thought
that the db sync commands actually create a database, which
they do not.

Change-Id: Ie6c3a5dc61a288935829276cc72f7f7563e20420
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify placement DB schema migration

This just clarifies in the release note for the optional
placement database that the database itself is not created
when running "nova-manage api_db sync", but rather the
database schema is created. This is important since a
non-trivial number of people over the years have thought
that the db sync commands actually create a database, which
they do not.

Change-Id: Ie6c3a5dc61a288935829276cc72f7f7563e20420

commit_message:
Rollback dulwich to 0.19.2

We need to have 0.19.2 until 0.19.4 is
released, the error problem is explained in [1].
Avoid unicode characters (e.g. the digraph ĳ in my surname) in setup.cfg,
+    since setuptools doesn't deal well with them. See
+    https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/1062. (Jelmer Vernooĳ, #637)

dulwich 0.18.3 breaks in instack-undercloud with:

Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
      File "/tmp/pip-install-ph6c_nsn/dulwich/setup.py", line 96, in <module>
        **setup_kwargs
      File "/repos/instack-undercloud/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/setuptools/__init__.py", line 128, in setup
        _install_setup_requires(attrs)
      File "/repos/instack-undercloud/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/setuptools/__init__.py", line 121, in _install_setup_requires
        dist.parse_config_files(ignore_option_errors=True)
      File "/repos/instack-undercloud/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/setuptools/dist.py", line 492, in parse_config_files
        _Distribution.parse_config_files(self, filenames=filenames)
      File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/distutils/dist.py", line 395, in parse_config_files
        parser.read(filename)
      File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/configparser.py", line 697, in read
        self._read(fp, filename)
      File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/configparser.py", line 1015, in _read
        for lineno, line in enumerate(fp, start=1):
      File "/repos/instack-undercloud/.tox/py36/lib64/python3.6/encodings/ascii.py", line 26, in decode
        return codecs.ascii_decode(input, self.errors)[0]
    UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xc4 in position 48: ordinal not in range(128)

    ----------------------------------------
Command "python setup.py egg_info" failed with error code 1 in /tmp/pip-install-ph6c_nsn/dulwich/

[1]: https://github.com/dulwich/dulwich/commit/1b6509fa3dbd05c458990b71fadff91af095f733

Closes-Bug: 1778004
Change-Id: Icabb56b9c6b2d99d78a7e1a77f8fe7a4ea6fa0c8

commit_message:
Modify the Ironic api-ref's parameters in parameters.yaml

Separate parameter identifiers in case when a parameter
is required in the request or response.
This patch adjusts the relevant *.nic file to fix the problem.

Change-Id: Ie2c8cae2280fc1e92a5e6f3fef4f2783a12a2c3f
Story: #1651775
Task: #10160

commit_message:
Stop assuming all containers are plans

This assumption doesn't hold true now that we're storing in containers
swift rings and messages associated to a plan.

Change-Id: I993460b3987136d4ea0ce0c326239ad70b9be8a9
Closes-Bug: #1769181

commit_message:
Pass DockerCephDaemonImage to CephMgr

Previously we did not pass DockerCephDaemonImage to roles where
CephMgr service was deployed isolated from the other Ceph services.

Change-Id: Icf674e17ed6a1347a6a89775b6a3f7964d28ab8e
Closes-Bug: 1775679
(cherry picked from commit 6f103876db10bd966a89df95bdd3ad5ae7e9a77e)

commit_message:
Use the standard messaging in the support workbook

Update the support workbook to use the standard message sending
workflow. This workflow reduces the boilerplate that is copied between
workflows by defining the message structure, providing the retry logic
and ensuring the task on a "FAILED" message.

The workflow also offers optional persistence in Swift. If the plan name
is given to the workflow it will store the messages in a Swift container
named <plan_name>-messages.

Change-Id: I9f914489630b9de59ffa819093b8b54e135877e8
Related-Bug: #1757372

The same forces that jammed it in the last time are going to do it again if you sneakily drop those underscores.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-12-27 21:07:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

We seem to be reinventing exceptions; how about I just raise ValueError, and handle in callers?

On the i18n log messages, see bug 1674543 -- I'll call it out in the commit message, though, to be less sneaky."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-12-27 21:07:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-12-27 21:10:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Have check_drive raise ValueError on errors

...which helps us differentiate between a drive that's not mounted vs.
not a dir better in log messages. We were already doing that a bit in
diskfile.py, and it seems like a useful distinction; let's do it more.

While we're at it, remove some log translations.

commit_message:
Ensure appropriate ACL mask is set on CephX keyrings

Changing group permissions alters the ACL mask, causing the "read"
permission we set explicitly for the openstack users to be ignored.

This change ensures "read" is set for the ACLs mask.

Change-Id: I4f94a3f7ab2c55a8c45363b8354be99d52980a7b
Closes-Bug: 1775549
(cherry picked from commit 2268bd1a71acacc391a695f9ae93ee5163c2481b)

commit_message:
Adds Senlin support to openstacksdk

Adds Senlin API to openstacksdk, along with unit and functional tests
for each Senlin function. Allows openstacksdk to create, list, get,
update and delete clusters, cluster policies, cluster profiles, and
cluster receivers. Also allows for attaching and detaching policies
to clusters, updating policies on clusters, and listing policies on clusters.

Change-Id: I7e80e8ba74bdb415c2359f5c9672aa900f441fba

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 02:01:35.000000000', 'message': 'Gate latest Fedora by using the fedora-latest nodeset

Fedora release new releases pretty often and the infrastructure
team does not want to maintain multiple images of Fedora.  Therefore,
they are suggesting that we use the `fedora-latest` nodeset to always
get the latest Fedora release. This is similar to the `debian-stable`
nodeset.

Change-Id: Ib19b9c5ff061e5250d65e4e397e599d70995fc76
'}]
commit_message:
Gate latest Fedora by using the fedora-latest nodeset

Fedora release new releases pretty often and the infrastructure
team does not want to maintain multiple images of Fedora.  Therefore,
they are suggesting that we use the `fedora-latest` nodeset to always
get the latest Fedora release. This is similar to the `debian-stable`
nodeset.

Change-Id: Ib19b9c5ff061e5250d65e4e397e599d70995fc76

commit_message:
remove yum priority

In the past we were using priority in order to mask package from epel.
now we only install epel with a very limited list of allowed pkg and only when
needed. This patch remove the priority for yum repos.

Change-Id: Ic6525e013b96e00d115d13a2b9e8fb00c3000127

commit_message:
Stop installing sshpass with openstack_hosts

An OpenStack deployment does not need sshpass, so there is no need
for us to install it with every deployment.

Change-Id: Ie05dc74a36619cbd88204c4909e540c736431b6c

subject: Switch to using project-templates
messages:
[{'account_id': 28521, 'date': '2018-06-20 21:01:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-20 21:01:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-20 21:35:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-21 22:13:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Change-Id: Ia468712438ec79767c1b7bf2a2e7ccb2fc249d54
'}]

commit_message:
Add packages required for osprofiler

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.
these packages will provide deployers the ability to profile
a service on demand should they choose to enable the profile
functionality.

Change-Id: Ie33e8944c4be002f12f47916d26393cc43203f4f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Set Ceph pools rule_name to replicated_rule

By setting the value of rule_name explicitly, we prevent backward
incompatibility issues because the default which ceph-ansible uses
might fit a particular version of Ceph, not all.

Note that the actual value for rule_name is different in the Pike
backport, deploying Ceph Jewel, because it needs to be set to
"replicated_ruleset" and not "replicated_rule" as with Ceph Luminous.

Change-Id: I275c1ca53ea79eea607cbbb58aa21cae6d6be80b
Closes-Bug: 1776252
(cherry picked from commit dcf558628f62f12829044dbeee56047f485585f0)

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I9fd237292f7da50e60da398b1649001bf1829c66

commit_message:
install the python3 version of launchpadlib

Install both the python2 and python3 versions of launchpadlib. We need
a separate patch to change the version of python used to run the
launchpad commenting script (which lives in project-config), so we
need both versions of the library installed until we make the
transition.

Story: #2001691
Task: #8680
Change-Id: Ibe759aa571b54c11067b21ad99d0e41371e7a648
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

I think the code works and looks good. I'm a little worried about whether this could be considered a breaking change. If the former, then this is fine, but if the latter then I think we'd have to consider whether someone could be relying on keystone behaving this way."}, {'account_id': 23625, 'date': '2017-12-04 18:08:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-12-07 20:29:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Have project get domain_id from parent

This change makes it so that projects that do not have a
specified domain_id, but do have a specified parent_id to
retrieve the domain_id from its parent, taking into
consideration if the parent is a domain or not.

If the project cannot get the domain from the parent, then
it will default to the domain scoped by the token.

Change-Id: Ieec37b884463216711d2f201a1f3e30a185824ef

[{'created': '2018-06-12 15:28:19.000000000', 'message': 'tasks: lxc_volume: Always create the machines.raw file

The machines.raw file is only created if the 'machinectl set-limit'
command returns non-zero exit code. However, this file is expected to
be present later on so we need to make sure that we create without
taking the 'machinectl' exit code into consideration.

Fixes the following problem:

Change-Id: If96c870d317bc7a024169ffd04e8f4c10003ba74
fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "msg": "Device /var/lib/machines.raw not found."}

commit_message:
tasks: Always create the machines.raw file

The machines.raw file is only created if the 'machinectl set-limit'
command returns non-zero exit code. However, this file is expected to
be present later on so we need to make sure that we create without
taking the 'machinectl' exit code into consideration.

Fixes the following problem:

Change-Id: If96c870d317bc7a024169ffd04e8f4c10003ba74
fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "msg": "Device /var/lib/machines.raw not found."}
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add tripleo undercloud jobs to puppet intragration

Recent removal of deprecated options has broken the tripleo deployments
so lets add the basic undercloud jobs which has some coverage.

Change-Id: If97e1f910c86a794edc79b6141b79f64ca4793cf

(4 comments)

A few more things inline + please rebase'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-18 21:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-18 22:00:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(11 comments)

thank you. 

Responding to the feedback, there are brand new things introduced in this patchset. 

In order to support dict syntax for `attributes[key] = value` new AttributeDict was introduced with __setitem__ override.
In order to watch for future attributes and to invalidate the resource when user commits attribute updates, added Observer pattern otherwise AttributeDict cannot receive reference to future attribute resource because at the time of constructing it, the attribute is None. 
Is this the direction to go? Does this look ok?

Also added support for @odata.etag when updating attributes.

For other, see inline comments.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-06-19 15:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-06-20 12:28:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(17 comments)

Thank you! This thing is getting better!'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-21 14:29:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I'm sorry, I don't quite like the direction this is going now. The interface looks somewhat overcomplicated, and some bits are quite confusing (see my comment on the tests). I'd still prefer we keep a simple interface.

Also, to be honest, I would prefer we merge the settings patch into this one. They are deeply interconnected in practice, and it is very hard to review one without the other. Sorry for inconvenience."}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-21 19:26:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(21 comments)

As discussed this is merged with Settings patch now. See updated version at [1].

See inline comments for updates for BIOS part here. Again as discussed to remove all the magic with dictionaries, the inline responses are mostly to say that these parts are removed together with all the issues they caused.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570555/'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-21 19:26:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-29 10:28:30.000000000', 'message': 'Introduces BIOS API

Adds `system` resource to have reference to `bios`.

Refactors `common` module to have `ResetActionField` and `ActionField`
for reusability.

There are 2 test cases for `BIOS` and `BIOS/Settings` that share the
same #Bios.v1_0_0.Bios datatype, but BIOS/Settings does not have
`Actions` and `@Redfish.Settings` fields.

`Bios` class has `settings` @property in order to load `settings`
dynamically from `BIOS/Settings` resource. Maybe this solution can be
improved to avoid manually loading from json in @property `settings`.

Change-Id: I8f531c034efefd36dcb131f1662993ca27bdb26d
Task: 12508
Story: 2001791

commit_message:
Introduce BIOS API

Add `system` resource to have reference to `bios`.

Support patching via @Redfish.Settings settings object resource.

Change-Id: I8f531c034efefd36dcb131f1662993ca27bdb26d
Task: 12508
Story: 2001791

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 10:00:03.000000000', 'message': 'Encode rendered unicode to a bytestring when ensuring config file

Jinja2 uses unicode, and the rendered result is unicode too. Therefore
the rendered result should be encoded to a bytestring to avoid
UnicodeEncodeError when output the result to a configuration file. Then
we can use non-ASCII for VPN service names and IPSec site connection
PSKs.

Closes-Bug: #1652909

Change-Id: Ie7edf080fc44537a74c57262bd9943c5e4337428
Signed-off-by: Hunt Xu <mhuntxu@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-01-10 14:36:07.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid using non-ASCII contents when generating config files

The name of a VPN service and the PSK of an IPsec site connection may
contains non-ASCII characters. Outputing plain texts of these contents
may lead to UnicodeEncodeError.

As *swan can support base64 encoded PSKs. With this commit, we
  1. use VPN service id instead of the name in configuration files, and
  2. encode IPsec site connection PSK with base64
to make sure that generated configuration files will only contain ASCII
characters.

Closes-Bug: #1652909

Change-Id: Ie7edf080fc44537a74c57262bd9943c5e4337428
Signed-off-by: Hunt Xu <mhuntxu@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-01-10 14:40:00.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid using non-ASCII characters when generating config files

commit_message:
Avoid using non-ASCII characters when generating config files

The name of a VPN service and the PSK of an IPsec site connection may
contain non-ASCII characters. Outputing plain texts of these contents
may lead to UnicodeEncodeError.

As *swan can support base64 encoded PSKs. With this commit, we
  1. use VPN service id instead of the name in configuration files, and
  2. encode IPsec site connection PSK with base64
to make sure that generated configuration files will only contain ASCII
characters.

Closes-Bug: #1652909

Change-Id: Ie7edf080fc44537a74c57262bd9943c5e4337428

commit_message:
Fall back to puppet-ntp defaults

If the ntp server is not configured in the undercloud.conf, we should
fall back to the defaults provided by puppet-ntp otherwise we end up
with an invalid ntp configuration.

Change-Id: I0000e1cf736b513dbc58c0d39f7e1c0137b660dd
Closes-BUg: #1777140

[{'created': '2018-04-20 20:50:02.000000000', 'message': "Always deploy NTP

No matter how many NTP servers we have in undercloud.conf, we need NTP
service running correctly, so the undercloud is always on time.
The default configuration already provide sane defaults
(X.centos.pool.ntp.org) so let's configure the service all the time.

Closes-Bug: #1765839
Change-Id: I946f055b119ea878c893bd333ebb5f2c9d68ea6d

commit_message:
Always deploy NTP

No matter how many NTP servers we have in undercloud.conf, we need NTP
service running correctly, so the undercloud is always on time.
The default configuration already provide sane defaults
(X.centos.pool.ntp.org) so let's configure the service all the time.

Closes-Bug: #1765839
Change-Id: I946f055b119ea878c893bd333ebb5f2c9d68ea6d
(cherry picked from commit 0498f5a64eaeed2f760aa771bc7d1e1db898a24a)

New compute/cpu_shared_set nova config can be set via parameter
NovaComputeCpuSharedSet.

Some workloads run best when the hypervisor overhead processes
(emulator threads in libvirt/QEMU) can be placed on different
physical host CPUs than other guest CPU resources. This allow
those workloads to prevent latency spikes for guest vCPU threads.

A list or range of physical CPU cores to reserve for for best-

can be specified.

commit_message:
Introduces NovaComputeCpuSharedSet parameter

New compute/cpu_shared_set nova config can be set via parameter
NovaComputeCpuSharedSet.

Some workloads run best when the hypervisor overhead processes
(emulator threads in libvirt/QEMU) can be placed on different
physical host CPUs than other guest CPU resources. This allow
those workloads to prevent latency spikes for guest vCPU threads.

A list or range of physical CPU cores to reserve for for best-
effort guest vCPU resources (e.g. emulator threads in libvirt/QEMU)
can be specified.

Closes-Bug: 1776905

Change-Id: I53c567e8eeef12d582205b6e2d8310635555b5b8

commit_message:
Fall back to puppet-ntp defaults

If the ntp server is not configured in the undercloud.conf, we should
fall back to the defaults provided by puppet-ntp otherwise we end up
with an invalid ntp configuration.

Change-Id: I0000e1cf736b513dbc58c0d39f7e1c0137b660dd
Closes-BUg: #1777140
(cherry picked from commit d49442152a3318e5afcc86bb8af6e58a74b23878)

commit_message:
Updates logging.conf volume mounts, chomp configmap-etc whitespace

This updates the logging.conf volumemount in the charts to use the
configuration option for the location of the file as the mounting
path in the pod.  This also chomps the whitespace introduced as
part of the fluentd host and port configurations in order to
remove any unnecessary whitespace upon rendering the templates

Change-Id: I76bbf60d4eb92f85382bf0b44d9e2b84bfcb866c

commit_message:
Remove legacy rally jobs

It had happened. All Rally plugins for OpenStack has a separate
repository rally-openstack which is covered by in-tree zuul v3 native
jobs.

Since these plugins are removed with [*] there is no need to launch
legacy jobs there.

[*] I36e56759f02fe9560b454b7a396e0493da0be0ab

Needed-By: I10d868199e3bf74a066c17ed823a5f4b2c947b58
Change-Id: Iaf43583b3f753546f9d6f12140d166978d19af51

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-20 23:58:15.000000000', 'message': "Bump packethost max servers to 100

This was originally set to 95 to ensure that we would have room to boot
test nodes if we needed them and to avoid conflict with our slightly
bigger than expected mirror host. However, we have quota for 100 and
nodepool has learned to dynamically check against quota so we should be
able to safely boot test instances and nodepool will avoid running up
against the quota accidentally.

As for the slightly larger than expected mirror node it is using more
disk which I don't think is one of the resource constraints we have to
worry about instead ram is our constraint but we are using only 8GB of
ram for the mirror node.

Change-Id: Ief5e8b923aab4f623c983c260c74d37fc3436836
"}]
commit_message:
Bump packethost max servers to 100

This was originally set to 95 to ensure that we would have room to boot
test nodes if we needed them and to avoid conflict with our slightly
bigger than expected mirror host. However, we have quota for 100 and
nodepool has learned to dynamically check against quota so we should be
able to safely boot test instances and nodepool will avoid running up
against the quota accidentally.

As for the slightly larger than expected mirror node it is using more
disk which I don't think is one of the resource constraints we have to
worry about instead ram is our constraint but we are using only 8GB of
ram for the mirror node.

Change-Id: Ief5e8b923aab4f623c983c260c74d37fc3436836

commit_message:
Remove direct tagging from swift-bench ACL

Releases now go through openstack/releases changes, in order
to properly test that the release will go through before
pushing the tag. Future releases of swift-bench (if any)
should go through this process.

Change-Id: If4db4b1afa17a2f1a7ab130fe12e55d9748fbb36

commit_message:
sphinxext: Use 'sphinx.util.logging'

This resolves a deprecation warning. It also allows us to silence some
of the noise that reno emits (unnecessarily, most of the time) during a
doc build.

Change-Id: Ifdc14f0c0ebb82981fc79f9a24f7673b38a3bedf
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Set container create tasks to non-voting/fix pkg

There are some inter-dependencies here where the container tasks will
not pass until a few updates are in both here and elsewhere. This change
sets the container create tasks to non-voting until all of the required
updates get in.

Remove the aria2 requirement

While aria2 has some nice features, the get_url command can do most of
what we need and does so in a far more universal way. This change
removes the aria2 dependency and updates the aria2 tasks to use the
get_url module.

Change-Id: Iab422c718d789ef13b8ec55938fdb7e73e40061b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 10:35:33.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7e6d76b8dd2b037e766d11d1cf1560c0b08c637b
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7e6d76b8dd2b037e766d11d1cf1560c0b08c637b

commit_message:
Switch test runner to django default runner

nose is not actively maintained now and Django default test runner
seems to have enough features.

Also drops unnecessary python dependencies so that
the maintenance of requirements files easily.
There is no need to install Django explicitly as it is a horizon dependency.
testscenarios, testrepository, testtools are not used actually.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544296/
Change-Id: Ic360c181d1f3278957007fc7188560893cc5ed03

Add mirrors for EPEL and Percona

We are configuring EPEL and Percona with the ability of customizing

using the mirrors as well.

commit_message:
Use policy directories support in horizon

Horizon added the policy directory support (policy.d) in Queens
which is a wrapper for policy_dirs configuration in oslo.policy.
We can now use the policy file from neutron-fwaas as-is.

* Change the service name from 'neutron-fwaas' to 'network'.
* Sync the sample policy file with the one in neutron-fwaas repo.
* Correct the policy names in FWaaS v2 table to match those
  from neutron-fwaas repo.
* Update the document and devstack plugin.

Change-Id: I63a79922470e644f95ac0cadf9d50095d4902735

replying to requests

commit_message:
Add support for neutron provider networks

Kolla provides a flag, enable_neutron_provider_networks, to enable
virtualised compute nodes to access provider (e.g. flat, VLAN) networks.

In kayobe, we now connect compute nodes to the external networks when
this flag is set. This ensures that the OVS network on compute nodes
is wired into the external networks.

Change-Id: Ida3d8eb2e2bfc95f6007c105ce410b3e5d360afe
Story: 2002636

subject: Fix error in router port maintenance code
messages: [{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-06-07 09:37:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-06-13 09:04:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-06-21 13:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-06-21 14:11:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1\n\nsetting +a for this cause it's important"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 09:37:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix error in router port maintenance code

When a port needs to be created or updated on OVN side by the
maintenance task we need to recover the router ID from the
port, which is on the device_id field.
At some point in time during development it got changed to
device_owner, which is a logical name referring to the type
of owner: compute, router, dhcp, etc...)

Also, when getting the lrouter port from the NBDB we were
using a uuid, while we needed to convert uuid to lrp port
name.

Those mistakes was causing the maintenance code uncapable of
recovering router ports that were detected as outdated, or
not created on the OVN side.

Change-Id: Iea8060b11cc4076e6efc300dd9079ddafcc3fb5e
Closes-Bug: 1746979
(cherry picked from commit 251aabd857c5afa736c9cf9f5427bcc05f857e81)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix error in router port maintenance code

When a port needs to be created or updated on OVN side by the
maintenance task we need to recover the router ID from the
port, which is on the device_id field.
At some point in time during development it got changed to
device_owner, which is a logical name referring to the type
of owner: compute, router, dhcp, etc...)

Also, when getting the lrouter port from the NBDB we were
using a uuid, while we needed to convert uuid to lrp port
name.

Those mistakes was causing the maintenance code uncapable of
recovering router ports that were detected as outdated, or
not created on the OVN side.

Change-Id: Iea8060b11cc4076e6efc300dd9079ddafcc3fb5e
Closes-Bug: 1746979
(cherry picked from commit 251aabd857c5afa736c9cf9f5427bcc05f857e81)

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Enhancement on volume metadata

Enhancement to have another key-value pair, Volume_metadata = "y / n"
to indicate volume metadata availability status. If debug is turned from on
to off the next operation will result in stale data using the cinder show command.
Solution is to clear the metadata and set the volume_metadata = 'n' in this
scenario.

Change-Id: Ie5857a7146ff856c1cbd1308c7cd4d6d0894edca
Closes-Bug: #1777135

commit_message:
Remove the 'osel' project

The 'osel' project is not supported, not working, and it has been requested
that it be scrubbed from the infrastructure.

Change-Id: Ifc1bbe7e7e4b82587e3a19e2e2029b48ec8960c7

commit_message:
Use up to date parameter name for cli options conversion

Use OvercloudControllerFlavor which is the up to date parameter name
when converting --control-flavor option(as introduced by
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/480272/ )

Change-Id: Ib5751cd396f69d448292d89acd9eda9ee146f14b
(cherry picked from commit 2ce0f125e13e22de7ed787e71484ccf509862c1f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 18:31:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: Router port always marked as DOWN

Router ports in OVN is never bound to a host given their decentralized
nature. For that reason, the code in Neutron core that change the status
of the ports (router ports are normal ports underneath) was ignoring the
OVN router ports.

This patch is forcing the status of those router ports to ACTIVE in
networking-ovn. A comment was left in the code in case we want to change
the core Neutron approach in the future.

This patch is also enabling two tempest tests that checks for this
router port status which were disabled before.

Change-Id: I5fd18e6e395a783e9591c058b80b63d42b24a3df
Closes-Bug: #1715126
(cherry picked from commit 9d0bc3e93879c901eaf989aaaf2ec224acb6dac5)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: Router port always marked as DOWN

Router ports in OVN is never bound to a host given their decentralized
nature. For that reason, the code in Neutron core that change the status
of the ports (router ports are normal ports underneath) was ignoring the
OVN router ports.

This patch is forcing the status of those router ports to ACTIVE in
networking-ovn. A comment was left in the code in case we want to change
the core Neutron approach in the future.

This patch is also enabling two tempest tests that checks for this
router port status which were disabled before.

Change-Id: I5fd18e6e395a783e9591c058b80b63d42b24a3df
Closes-Bug: #1715126
(cherry picked from commit 9d0bc3e93879c901eaf989aaaf2ec224acb6dac5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 09:55:15.000000000', 'message': "Add default dns_server option in DHCP_Options table

If a subnet is not defined with dns_nameservers option, then networking-ovn
doesn't add any default 'dns_server' DHCPv4 option in the DHCP_Options table.

This patch addresses this issue by
 - Introducing a config option - 'dns_servers' similar to 'dnsmasq_dns_servers'
   config option supported by dhcp agent and uses it as the 'dns_server' DHCPv4 option
   in the DHCP_Options table.

 - If the 'dns_servers' option is not defined, then it uses the system dns resolvers
   from the /etc/resolv.conf.

Closes-bug: #1774052
Change-Id: Ibf6396232f8eac780baa676b0b8395082d5c3527
(cherry picked from commit ff5a4a0f6b8867066b666d5e63116691e8d223bb)
"}]
commit_message:
Add default dns_server option in DHCP_Options table

If a subnet is not defined with dns_nameservers option, then networking-ovn
doesn't add any default 'dns_server' DHCPv4 option in the DHCP_Options table.

This patch addresses this issue by
 - Introducing a config option - 'dns_servers' similar to 'dnsmasq_dns_servers'
   config option supported by dhcp agent and uses it as the 'dns_server' DHCPv4 option
   in the DHCP_Options table.

 - If the 'dns_servers' option is not defined, then it uses the system dns resolvers
   from the /etc/resolv.conf.

Closes-bug: #1774052
Change-Id: Ibf6396232f8eac780baa676b0b8395082d5c3527
(cherry picked from commit ff5a4a0f6b8867066b666d5e63116691e8d223bb)

commit_message:
ovs-dpdk: add dpdk-bond-config config option

This allows more fine grained control over the bond mode
and LACP settings. Directly mapped to what OVS-DPDK configuration
exposes.

Change-Id: I1cca1043058f1ec99f194c1bdb611ebd603d646d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-21 14:15:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add bond-mappings configuration option

The current charm does not support creating and managing bonded network
interfaces. They are managed externaly. This is not possible when DPDK
is enabled. In this case OVS exposes the DPDK bond PMD which enslaves
the corresponding attached bond interfaces.

The new bond-mappings configuration option allows such configuration
where mac:bond is specified. When the data-port configuration is processed
the new bond-mappings are consulted to identify if the port belongs to
a bond. If this is true - then the bond is created with the mac designated
interface and the bond is added to the bridge. Subsequently more interfaces
can be added to the same bond.

Change-Id: I0224caaa1c2431c793c4f64caa7fc9e95b972fd7
Signed-off-by: Nikolay Nikolaev <nikolay.nikolaev@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add dpdk-bond-mappings configuration option

The current charm does not support creating and managing bonded network
interfaces. They are managed externaly. This is not possible when DPDK
is enabled. In this case OVS exposes the DPDK bond PMD which enslaves
the corresponding attached bond interfaces.

The new dpdk-bond-mappings configuration option allows such configuration
where mac:bond is specified. When the data-port configuration is processed
dpdk-bond-mappings are consulted to identify if the port belongs to a bond.
If this is true - then the bond is created with the mac designated interface
and the bond is added to the bridge. Subsequently more interfaces can be
added to the same bond.

Change-Id: I0224caaa1c2431c793c4f64caa7fc9e95b972fd7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-21 14:15:10.000000000', 'message': 'ovs-dpdk: support late initialization since ovs 2.6.0

OVS 2.6.0 introduces new mechanisms to configure the DPDK netdev
provider. It now relies on the database and allows dynamic runtime
configuration. Network interface binding is more fine grained by
specifying the NIC PCI address and not relying on special port naming
and indexing.

Here we introduce the support of post 2.6.0 OVS-DPDK and change the
relevant tests.

Change-Id: Ic0185097d65df04a2b566e16cb22bcbd088eed3e
Signed-off-by: Nikolay Nikolaev <nikolay.nikolaev@canonical.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-05-21 16:00:54.000000000', 'message': 'ovs-dpdk: support late initialization since ovs 2.6.0

Here we introduce the support of post 2.6.0 OVS-DPDK and change the
relevant tests.

Change-Id: Ic0185097d65df04a2b566e16cb22bcbd088eed3e
'}]
commit_message:
ovs-dpdk: support late initialization since ovs 2.6.0

OVS 2.6.0 introduces new mechanisms to configure the DPDK netdev
provider. It now relies on the database and allows dynamic runtime
configuration. Network interface binding is more fine grained by
specifying the NIC PCI address and not relying on special port naming
and indexing.

Here we introduce the support of post 2.6.0 OVS-DPDK and change the
relevant tests.

Change-Id: Ic0185097d65df04a2b566e16cb22bcbd088eed3e

commit_message:
Set ovsdb probe interval to 1 minute on the client side

When a failover of ovsdb-server occurs, neither neutron-server nor
ovn-metadata-agent detects the disconnection. Even though this should
be fixed in OVS Python IDL, this patch is adding a default probe
interval from the client side to 60 seconds. This way, when the
connection to the VIP is lost, clients will reconnect and the service
will be back up again.

Change-Id: Idec3344136a85d73969ed8e11d358b66c14d9a4d
Closes-Bug: #1772656
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 90c2a1c26f5ec276a1154648538efd373e458afa)

[{'created': '2018-06-14 11:12:29.000000000', 'message': "Switch to dnf when it exists

This has all been around for a *long* time, like when dnf was a weird

Choose it by default for platforms with it (Fedora, for now).

commit_message:
Switch to dnf when it exists

This has all been around for a *long* time, like when dnf was a weird
new thing.  Now it's the opposite and yum is a weird old thing :)
Choose it by default for platforms with it (Fedora, for now).

Change-Id: Id2bd7d145354b996de31944929fd0267ec24a08e

subject: Fix unit tests to reflect new oslo.context
messages:
[{'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-06-18 21:07:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-06-19 04:08:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

There is already a patch proposed by Sampath to fix same issue.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575020/1

I agree with you that unit tests should be modified to verify masakari-specific keys in the context to avoid similar issue in the future.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-06-21 14:51:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-18 21:07:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unit tests to reflect new oslo.context

oslo.context has added a new key and changed the type of one of the
entrys in the context dict, and since the unit tests assert on the
entire contents of the dict they need to be updated to reflect that.

Note that these unit tests should probably be rewritten to only verify
masakari-specific keys in the context to avoid similar issues in the
future.

Change-Id: Ie423ca3ee942d73b845cf5f1bfd55748c229e617
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unit tests to reflect new oslo.context

oslo.context has added a new key and changed the type of one of the
entrys in the context dict, and since the unit tests assert on the
entire contents of the dict they need to be updated to reflect that.

Note that these unit tests should probably be rewritten to only verify
masakari-specific keys in the context to avoid similar issues in the
future.

Change-Id: Ie423ca3ee942d73b845cf5f1bfd55748c229e617

commit_message:
remove yum priority

in the past we were using priority in order to mask package from epel.
now we only install epel with a very limited list of allowed pkg and only when
needed. This patch remove the priority for yum repos.

Depends-On: Ic6525e013b96e00d115d13a2b9e8fb00c3000127
Depends-On: Ie05dc74a36619cbd88204c4909e540c736431b6c
Change-Id: I15dc189eef7093aee4b314ec379d3c6f21900da2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 14:48:59.000000000', 'message': "Remove proxy-sendcl from mod_proxy_uwsgi apache path

Calling setenv appears to be globally scoped which is breaking the
glance path which relies on chunked uploads. The glance path is
separated by using mod_proxy instead of mod_proxy_uwsgi because
mod_proxy_uwsgi doesn't support chunked encoding.[1] The proxy-sendcl [2]
was set on the mod_proxy_uwsgi path just in case someone tried to send a
chunked request to the api server we would be able to handle it. It
tells apache to locally cache the chunked request and send the
content-length as a normal upload to the upstream server. However, if we
can only set it globally across then small potential benefit is not worth
having all glance uploads cached by apache. This commit just removes
setting the flag. In the future if we can have devstack isolate this
flag it might be worth adding back to the mod_proxy_uwsgi path, but for
right now it's not worth the tradeoff.

[1] https://github.com/unbit/uwsgi/issues/1540
[2] https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_proxy.html#request-bodies

Depends-On: Idf6b4b891ba31cccbeb53d373b40fce5380cea64
Change-Id: Iab2e2848877fa1497008d18c05b0154892941589
Closes-Bug: #1709970
(cherry picked from commit a3488d5f0067b570974c14572c58bbf8cedf7ed2)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove proxy-sendcl from mod_proxy_uwsgi apache path

Calling setenv appears to be globally scoped which is breaking the
glance path which relies on chunked uploads. The glance path is
separated by using mod_proxy instead of mod_proxy_uwsgi because
mod_proxy_uwsgi doesn't support chunked encoding.[1] The proxy-sendcl [2]
was set on the mod_proxy_uwsgi path just in case someone tried to send a
chunked request to the api server we would be able to handle it. It
tells apache to locally cache the chunked request and send the
content-length as a normal upload to the upstream server. However, if we
can only set it globally across then small potential benefit is not worth
having all glance uploads cached by apache. This commit just removes
setting the flag. In the future if we can have devstack isolate this
flag it might be worth adding back to the mod_proxy_uwsgi path, but for
right now it's not worth the tradeoff.

[1] https://github.com/unbit/uwsgi/issues/1540
[2] https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_proxy.html#request-bodies

Depends-On: Idf6b4b891ba31cccbeb53d373b40fce5380cea64
Change-Id: Iab2e2848877fa1497008d18c05b0154892941589
Closes-Bug: #1709970
(cherry picked from commit a3488d5f0067b570974c14572c58bbf8cedf7ed2)

commit_message:
redhat: Add the EPEL repository for aria2 packages

The ARIA2 package is needed from EPEL so we install it inside
the role. Moreover, in order to minimize the potential EPEL vs RDO
package conflicts, we only allow a small subset of packages from the
EPEL repository. Finally, we include the nodepool playbook from the
tests repository in order to populate the necessary CI facts.

Change-Id: Ibf4a09c2e86fc960f61a150077850045d534ad5f

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28206, 'date': '2018-05-20 11:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28206, 'date': '2018-05-21 09:31:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28206, 'date': '2018-05-21 11:11:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28206, 'date': '2018-05-21 12:42:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

[{'account_id': 26006, 'date': '2018-05-11 15:14:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-05-11 15:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26006, 'date': '2018-05-11 16:09:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Couple of comments. Other fixes incoming.'}, {'account_id': 26006, 'date': '2018-05-11 16:12:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-05-11 16:37:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Good start. Haven't looked at the tests yet, will do so after lunch. Some comments in line, and a thought about mixed version live migration.

I think we also need to handle the case where a new compute that has file backed memory is live migrated to a compute that hasn't been upgraded yet? Ie, assuming this lands in rocky, a rocky->pike live migration. The dest would send file_backed in migrate_data, but the source would just ignore it. By pure chance I'm working on something similar with NUMA-aware live migration (spec: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/rocky/approved/numa-aware-live-migration.html), and what I've done is just refused the live migration unless both computes are rocky (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566723/). Would something similar make sense here? Dan?"}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-05-11 16:45:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> So, there are 3 source/dest cases:

4 cases, actually, forgot normal -> normal'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-05-11 17:09:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (4 comments)
 > 
 > Good start. Haven't looked at the tests yet, will do so after
 > lunch. Some comments in line, and a thought about mixed version
 > live migration.
 > 
 > I think we also need to handle the case where a new compute that
 > has file backed memory is live migrated to a compute that hasn't
 > been upgraded yet? Ie, assuming this lands in rocky, a rocky->pike
 > live migration. The dest would send file_backed in migrate_data,
 > but the source would just ignore it. By pure chance I'm working on
 > something similar with NUMA-aware live migration (spec:
 > https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/rocky/approved/numa-aware-live-migration.html),
 > and what I've done is just refused the live migration unless both
 > computes are rocky (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566723/).
 > Would something similar make sense here? Dan?

We really can't do that, IMHO. It means that the scheduler will often pick invalid destinations if you want to rely on it. And, if you have a tightly-packed cloud and need to do the slide puzzle thing to make your upgrade work, blocking live migrations is really (really) frustrating for users."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-05-11 17:23:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> We really can't do that, IMHO. It means that the scheduler will
> often pick invalid destinations if you want to rely on it. And, if
> you have a tightly-packed cloud and need to do the slide puzzle
> thing to make your upgrade work, blocking live migrations is really
> (really) frustrating for users.

Yeah, I suppose it's different in this case - with NUMA, live migrating rocky -> pike to a host that doens't support it would just break. Here it's not big deal, since the pike compute can use normal host RAM. Does the current code handle that transparently? I think it does? The source would send file_backed in migrate_data to the dest, the dest would ignore it (via conductor object version backport) and send migrate_data back to the source without file_backed, and the source would update the XML accordingly. So I think we're good?"}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-05-11 17:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-18361 : SUCCESS in 1h 14m 54s'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-05-11 18:36:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Tests look OK, pending fixes to make Zuul happy :)'}, {'account_id': 26006, 'date': '2018-05-11 20:14:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I think we also need to handle the case where a new compute that
 > has file backed memory is live migrated to a compute that hasn't
 > been upgraded yet? Ie, assuming this lands in rocky, a rocky->pike
 > live migration. The dest would send file_backed in migrate_data,
 > but the source would just ignore it. By pure chance I'm working on
 > something similar with NUMA-aware live migration (spec:
 > https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/rocky/approved/numa-aware-live-migration.html),
 > and what I've done is just refused the live migration unless both
 > computes are rocky (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566723/).
 > Would something similar make sense here? Dan?

I don't think this is an issue for migrating to an older version (rocky->pike). Since this is configured per node, there's no way to configure a pike node to have file backed memory, so the (rocky) source would see no file_backed_memory in the migrate_data, and properly remove the memoryBacking elements.

This is an issue migrating from an older system to a newer system with file backed memory enabled (pike->rocky), where the older compute node will ignore the file_backed_memory attribute, and cause a non-file-backed instance to spin up on a node where only file-backed instances should be."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-05-11 21:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

(24 comments)

Mostly OK, I haven't dug into unit tests yet given the amount of comments in the code changes itself. Doesn't seem like there is anything major missing here *except* for the ram_allocation_ratio being set per host aggregates in the scheduler - I'd like to know what we're doing about that. Maybe the answer is, "you just can't have hosts configured for file-backed memory in host aggregates where ram_allocation_ratio!=1.0" - and that might be sufficient, but it needs to be documented. Ideally we could validate that in the actual AggregateRamFilter using something from the HostState object, but that's a bit more advanced - and something we could add later if we wanted/needed.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-19 15:49:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

commit_message:
Implement file backed memory for instances in libvirt

File backed memory is enabled per Nova compute host. When enabled, host
will report 'file_backed_memory_capacity' for available memory.

When enabled, instances will create memory backing files in the
directory specified in libvirt's qemu.conf file 'memory_backing_dir'
config option.

This feature is not compatible with memory overcommit, and requires
'ram_allocation_ratio' to be set to 1.0

Change-Id: I676291ec0faa1dea0bd5050ef8e3426d171de4c6
Implements: blueprint libvirt-file-backed-memory

commit_message:
API: Add ``all_tenants`` parameter

When administrarots query snapshots, share networks, or security
services, they may set ``all_tenants`` to true to get records for all
OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Ia208dec102295f1021ce5c4da88397e7946c8dba

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-21 01:26:30.000000000', 'message': "Fix width of team badges svg

Use the max width of all rows to determine
width of the svg generated, rather than taking
the last element's width; this will work regardless
of whether there are 4 badges in the last row.

Change-Id: Ibc427bca0acdab119c0c2b358bba04eec7418327
"}]
commit_message:
Fix width of team badges svg

Use the max width of all rows to determine
width of the svg generated, rather than taking
the last element's width; this will work regardless
of whether there are 4 badges in the last row.

Change-Id: Ibc427bca0acdab119c0c2b358bba04eec7418327

"}, {'created': '2018-06-20 14:38:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pep8, py27, pip install error and tempest

This patch is a squash of four fix that are needed together to have a
successful zuul run.

1. pep8 fix (cherry-picked from master:
   87eb1b15be8a4e39f3344f829d1a5b295a37a858 )

A recent change in pep/pycodingchecks introduced new warnings as part of
the pep8 target that causes pep8 to fail now.

This patch fixes code that issued warnings W503,E731,E266,E402

In addition, old tests which were not ran anyway, and are no longer
relevant (test_firewall) were deleted.

Conflicts:
	neutron_fwaas/tests/tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/manager.py

2. Avoid parameterless pip install

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on all stable branches due to the
new pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case
of calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to
pip.

This patch also disables E402 hacking check because releasenotes/* violates it
(the issue is not present in Queens+ where
Ib19f7ea4ea136180f38bc78389f51b6b5d179ab8 is merged).

Conflicts:
      neutron_fwaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/queens/expand/876782258a43_create_default_firewall_groups_table.py

      tox.ini

3. tests: don't rely on configuration files outside tests directory

Following the similar Neutron change. [1]

Recently, the way sibling projects are installed were changed.
It broke networking-midonet gate as neutron-fwaas was installed
under site-packages, where the etc directory is not available.

[1] If1f5ebd981cf06558d5102524211799676068889

Closes-Bug: #1758062

4. Adding cleanup of router in unit tests

Resources must be cleanup after each test in order to free
resources.

This patch fixes the legacy-neutron-fwaas-v1-dsvm-tempest jobs

Change-Id: I72aeeac8cbe07f6fc6cb4acf54fb632587d890a0

commit_message:
Fix pep8, py27, pip install error and tempest

This patch is a squash of four fix that are needed together to have a
successful zuul run.

1. pep8 fix (cherry-picked from master:
   87eb1b15be8a4e39f3344f829d1a5b295a37a858 )

A recent change in pep/pycodingchecks introduced new warnings as part of
the pep8 target that causes pep8 to fail now.

This patch fixes code that issued warnings W503,E731,E266,E402

In addition, old tests which were not ran anyway, and are no longer
relevant (test_firewall) were deleted.

Conflicts:
	neutron_fwaas/tests/tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/manager.py

2. Avoid parameterless pip install

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on all stable branches due to the
new pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case
of calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to
pip.

This patch also disables E402 hacking check because releasenotes/* violates it
(the issue is not present in Queens+ where
Ib19f7ea4ea136180f38bc78389f51b6b5d179ab8 is merged).

Conflicts:
      neutron_fwaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/queens/expand/876782258a43_create_default_firewall_groups_table.py
      neutron_fwaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/queens/expand/f24e0d5e5bff_uniq_firewallgroupportassociation0port.py
      neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/fwaas_plugin_v2.py
      neutron_fwaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/pike/contract/fd38cd995cc0_shared_attribute_for_firewall_resources.py
      neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/extensions/test_firewall.py
      tox.ini

3. tests: don't rely on configuration files outside tests directory

Following the similar Neutron change. [1]

Recently, the way sibling projects are installed were changed.
It broke networking-midonet gate as neutron-fwaas was installed
under site-packages, where the etc directory is not available.

[1] If1f5ebd981cf06558d5102524211799676068889

Closes-Bug: #1758062

4. Adding cleanup of router in unit tests

Resources must be cleanup after each test in order to free
resources.

This patch fixes the legacy-neutron-fwaas-v1-dsvm-tempest jobs

Change-Id: I72aeeac8cbe07f6fc6cb4acf54fb632587d890a0
(cherry picked from commit 58a62382e939b47d7bb75e985852aa214f9f3cdd)
(cherry picked from commit 1d884eab72375af862d50045acc2aa7b62985207)
(cherry picked from commit 200a03439e4393af83f5bca1e0e18f196b024e5d)
(cherry picked from commit e1231cd6eabb0992820d0c0fdc629c8a96b5f6b9)
(cherry picked from commit 4f8dc35a056e003fcc7ad8f65368bc8f60163e85)

[{'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2017-10-17 06:08:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2017-10-17 06:11:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2017-10-17 06:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-10-21 06:16:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Why are you thinking that the services should be enabled? Is this something of a (currently) broken fedora cloud-init package?  (I'm currently using this element successfully for Ubuntu - and it works fine...)"}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2017-10-22 09:13:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Why are you thinking that the services should be enabled? Is this
 > something of a (currently) broken fedora cloud-init package?  (I'm
 > currently using this element successfully for Ubuntu - and it works
 > fine...)


these service should be enabled in order for cloud-init to work properly.
otherwise and in case of minimal-fedora they are not enabled those VM not configured properly."}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2017-10-22 09:13:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-10-24 05:37:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-10-24 07:11:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I'm still not convinced:

Created an Ubuntu Xenial with cloud-init without this patch - at it works perfect.

Could it be that this is a workaround of a fedora (packaging) issue? If so, please comment and leave the other distributions / release behind: when one distro / release uses a different name for the service, this will fail."}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2017-10-24 08:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> I'm still not convinced:
 > 
 > Created an Ubuntu Xenial with cloud-init without this patch - at it
 > works perfect.
 > 
 > Could it be that this is a workaround of a fedora (packaging)
 > issue? If so, please comment and leave the other distributions /
 > release behind: when one distro / release uses a different name for
 > the service, this will fail.

can you run on Ubuntu Xenial "systemctl is-enabled cloud-init cloud-init-local cloud-config cloud-final"
and see if all services are enabled?
I work with fedora 26 and when cloud-init installed the service are not enabled and needed to be manually enabled

will restricting this patch only to fedora will you give +1? if not what do you suggest to do?'}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2017-10-24 08:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2018-06-21 12:34:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
cloud-init element systemctl support

In case of using minimal distro like fedora-minial cloud-init services
are not enable, this patch for cloud-init element will make sure 
cloud-init installed and services enabled.

Change-Id: I120476c6c8059c334b602a5ca28de4a1c5019090

commit_message:
Configure tunnel interface ip

configure tunnel interface with address for active tunneling when deploy
controller and compute node.
 *TUNNEL_ENDPOINT_INTERFACE = interface name which will set ip address 
  on (TUNNEL_ENDPOINT_IP) set this param in local.conf

Change-Id: Ia2f4763fe34680a99c6f28ababa27ed6bb661baf
