revisions:
[{'created': '2016-08-25 14:27:45.000000000', 'message': 'create OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE bridge whenever it is set. Introduce new param PHYSICAL_INTERFACE to attach physical interface to bridge to.

Change-Id: I6c8bd653218548cf5146def292be78b955f3f957
'}, {'created': '2016-08-25 17:24:42.000000000', 'message': 'create OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE when paramter exist

ovs physical cridge was create only when not setting the paramter for 
neutron bridge mappings.
The fix will allways create the bridge when paramter OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE
is defined.
Attach PHYSICAL_INTERFACE* to OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE with ovs add-port.

New local.conf paramter
 * PHYSICAL_INTERFACE = physical interface which will be used for guet
   networking

Change-Id: I6c8bd653218548cf5146def292be78b955f3f957
'}, {'created': '2016-10-05 14:59:01.000000000', 'message': 'ovs-vsctl configure OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE when defined

This change make sure we configure OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE when the param is
defined.
Also for neutron vlan we wont need to pre-configure bridge
source: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/guides/neutron.html
$ sudo ovs-vsctl add-br br-ex
$ sudo ovs-vsctl add-port br-ex eth1

this patch take care of the above.

New local.conf paramter
 * PHYSICAL_INTERFACE = physical interface which will be used for guet
   networking

Change-Id: I6c8bd653218548cf5146def292be78b955f3f957
'}, {'created': '2016-11-01 20:35:49.000000000', 'message': 'ovs-vsctl configure OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE when defined

This change make sure we configure OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE when the param is
defined.
Also for neutron vlan we wont need to pre-configure bridge
source: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/guides/neutron.html
$ sudo ovs-vsctl add-br br-ex
$ sudo ovs-vsctl add-port br-ex eth1

this patch take care of the above.

New local.conf paramter
 * PHYSICAL_INTERFACE = physical interface which will be used for guet
   networking

Change-Id: I6c8bd653218548cf5146def292be78b955f3f957
'}, {'created': '2016-11-06 10:39:13.000000000', 'message': 'Create bridge "OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" on any stack run

This patch will create bridge "OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" on any stack run.
creation of this bridge should be independent on values like
"PHYSICAL_NETWORK" or "OVS_BRIDGE_MAPPINGS".

Change-Id: I6c8bd653218548cf5146def292be78b955f3f957

commit_message:
Create bridge "OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" when defined

This patch will make sure bridge "OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" is created
whenever the param "OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" is defined.

Change-Id: I6c8bd653218548cf5146def292be78b955f3f957

Q_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPE=vxlan,vlan

commit_message:
Allow to set Q_TUNNEL_TYPES directly

"Q_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPE" defines which network types a tenant allowed
to create.
"Q_TUNNEL_TYPES" defines which tunnel types are enabled in your OpenStack
environment.

This patch clarifies the use of the above parameters and allow users to
set "Q_TUNNEL_TYPES" directly in advance OpenStack networking cases.

Example:
Q_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPE=vxlan,vlan
Q_TUNNEL_TYPES=vxlan

Change-Id: Ida183e792383e1c8d5bf5cc47945ed6ffb253b72

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 13037, 'date': '2016-08-25 12:21:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-08-25 14:09:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Sorry, PUBLIC_BRIDGE'}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2016-11-06 13:11:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Published edit on patch set 9'}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2016-11-06 13:19:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> This changes OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE to PUBLIC_INTERFACE yet fails to
 > update any of our documentation.

updated commit message:

L3 correct bridge for external from OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE to PUBLIC_BRIDGE

by default "OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" and "PUBLIC_BRIDGE" are set to "br-ex"
that mean we use 1 bridge in OpenStack.

This patch fix l3 to allow a case when external and internal networking
are different bridges and different interfaces.

The patch also retain the old behavior because both parameters are set to
same bridge name by default.


----

In mind "l3" seem to be designed to be with this patch but someone probably forgot why he defined "PUBLIC_BRIDGE".
This patch will allow to defined different bridges for internal and external networking while retain same flow when it is the same bridge.

I follow the guides and they seem updated and not need to update any current documents.'}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2016-11-06 13:21:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Published edit on patch set 10'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-11-06 14:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Verified+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-08-25 12:21:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix public interface bridge

Change-Id: I82b2a437b9d262ddaf092c5f1ecbcd125ed9fe8b
'}, {'created': '2016-08-25 18:11:34.000000000', 'message': 'l3 fix move of pbulic address from PUBLIC_INTERFACE to OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE instaed to PUBLIC_BRIDGE

Change-Id: I82b2a437b9d262ddaf092c5f1ecbcd125ed9fe8b
'}, {'created': '2016-08-28 07:49:53.000000000', 'message': 'Allow to assigne PUBLIC_INTERFACE to the PUBLIC_BRIDGE

current code strict us to bind PUBLIC_INTERFACE to the OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE
In case we using different interface for physical(Guest netwrok) and public

Change-Id: I82b2a437b9d262ddaf092c5f1ecbcd125ed9fe8b
'}, {'created': '2016-10-05 09:31:14.000000000', 'message': 'Allow to assigne PUBLIC_INTERFACE to the PUBLIC_BRIDGE

current code strict us to bind PUBLIC_INTERFACE to the OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE
In case we using different interface for physical(Guest netwrok) and public

Change-Id: I82b2a437b9d262ddaf092c5f1ecbcd125ed9fe8b
'}, {'created': '2016-10-05 09:44:12.000000000', 'message': 'L3 change birdge the external bridge instead of OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE

currently we bridge OVS_PHYSIACL_BRIDGE to the PUBLIC_INTERFACE and its
incorrect (should be bridge to the external bridge).
Also the current code wont allow to define OVS_BRIDGE_MAPPINGS correctly
in case of multiple interfaces.

setup example:
eth1 - managemet.
eth2 - external network / instances external internet access / l3.
p2p1/eth3 - instance internal access.

local.conf example:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/584396/

Change-Id: I82b2a437b9d262ddaf092c5f1ecbcd125ed9fe8b
'}, {'created': '2016-10-05 09:47:22.000000000', 'message': 'L3 change birdge the external bridge instead of OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE

currently we bridge OVS_PHYSIACL_BRIDGE to the PUBLIC_INTERFACE and its
incorrect (should be bridged to the external bridge PUBLIC_BRIDGE).
Also the current code wont allow to define OVS_BRIDGE_MAPPINGS correctly
in case of multiple interfaces.

setup example:
eth1 - managemet.
eth2 - external network / instances external internet access / l3.
p2p1/eth3 - instance internal access.

commit_message:
L3 correct bridge for external from OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE to PUBLIC_BRIDGE

By default "OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" and "PUBLIC_BRIDGE" are set to "br-ex"
this means we use single bridge in OpenStack.

This patch fixes l3 to allow a scenario where external and internal
networking are different bridges and different interfaces.

The patch also retain the old behaver because both parameters are set to
same bridge name by default.

controller local.conf example:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/584396/

ovs-vsctl show output:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/588131/

Change-Id: I82b2a437b9d262ddaf092c5f1ecbcd125ed9fe8b

case, and system could not find it. Convert all labels to upper

commit_message:
Convert labels to upper case

When booting on UEFI, there was an issue mounting the vfat
filesystem. It was caused because the mount was defined in
/etc/fstab in lowercase, but the disk had it labeled in upper
case, and system could not find it. Conver the label to upper
case in case of fat/vfat.

Change-Id: Id3dee735e6f8fb221d199c4aba648f3e9a6e4206

Please also review https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#code-review and see what you can take from there.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-06-12 07:41:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

A potential alternate location for this would be the project team guide...

It depends how "Advanced" we expect people using this to be. The contributor guide is more step-by-step for new contributors, while the project team guide is more of a reference guide for existing contributors.

Since this one has advice on +2/-2 I feel like it's more project team guide material ?'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-06-12 09:06:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

will come back to this for real later, but had a quick comment'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-12 12:52:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-06-12 12:54:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Thank you for writing this! I don't feel strongly that anything needs to be changed right now, so voting +1 :)

I wonder if it is worth mentioning the use of 'nit:' to prefix comments that are minor? I don't know if that is common throughout OpenStack or just used by a few projects. Even if I do a follow up, I like to mark/comment things that can be improved in the original review. Otherwise, it means more work (re-reviewing) for me to do the follow up. It also means someone else can do the follow up."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-12 14:13:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)

> It depends how "Advanced" we expect people using this to be. The contributor guide is more step-by-step for new contributors, while the project team guide is more of a reference guide for existing contributors.
> 
> Since this one has advice on +2/-2 I feel like it's more project team guide material ?

Yeah, this is definitely aimed at all reviewers, from new contributors who want to learn the culture through to established core reviewers who may occasionally need reminding when they get out of step with the rest of the community :)

I'm pretty relaxed about where it ends up, so if we think the project team guide makes more sense then I'm happy to move it over there.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-06-12 15:01:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Thanks for doing this.  All-in-all it looks good.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-12 20:28:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-12 20:32:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

This patchset incorporates all of the fixes for the comments so far. I'm going to transfer this as-is to the project team guide and we can continue reviewing there. I'll update this patch again to only add cross-links to the project team guide."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-12 21:26:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-12 21:28:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-20 05:58:13.000000000', 'message': "Strip tags from titles in bugTitle and meta

We need to ensure that HTML tags in 'title' are stripped in these places
or the output will be corrupted. That makes the bug reporting links are
not working properly.

Change-Id: Iddc041488cb3b0dc4d784fef92920496ce1a747f
Closes-Bug: #1713054
"}]
commit_message:
Strip tags from titles in bugTitle and meta

We need to ensure that HTML tags in 'title' are stripped in these places
or the output will be corrupted. That makes the bug reporting links are
not working properly.

Change-Id: Iddc041488cb3b0dc4d784fef92920496ce1a747f
Closes-Bug: #1713054

This changes the README from a txt to rst file for output formatting
and corrects doc8 warnings causing package checks to fail.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 13:29:38.000000000', 'message': 'Add multi-vif driver to kuryr-k8s controller

This commit adds multi-vif driver to kuryr-k8s controller and
pass the most annotations parsing work from VIF-handler and
different drivers to it. Multi-vif driver is intended to get
list of enabled drivers, call all of these drivers to get vifs
from it, compose a dict of these vifs and pass this dict to
VIF-handler.

Change-Id: I1d1350f16092874d7f44f46df77efbad9b3cae44
Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@partner.samsung.com>

different drivers to it. Multi-vif driver is intended to get
list of enabled drivers, call all of these drivers to get vifs
from it, compose a dict of these vifs and pass this dict to
VIF-handler.

'}, {'created': '2018-06-21 05:51:00.000000000', 'message': 'Add multi-vif driver and related handler changes

Multi-vif driver allows additional vifs to be attached to a
single pod.

A new optional parameter "extra_specs" is introduced to request_vif in
pod-vif-drivers to distinguish among multiple vifs for a single pod

This commit also adds AnnotationMultiVIFDriver, an implementation of
multi-vif driver. A new annotation "openstack.org/kuryr-multi-vif-specs"
is introduced, which can be used by the user to request additional vifs
with given specifications.

Each vif's driver depends upon pod annotation and label of the node
where the pod is scheduled. All the vifs are then managed by the
corresponding drivers.

Change-Id: I1d1350f16092874d7f44f46df77efbad9b3cae44
Partially Implements: blueprint multi-vif-pods
Signed-off-by: Yash Gupta <y.gupta@samsung.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add multi-vif driver and related handler changes

Multi-vif driver allows additional vifs to be attached to a
single pod.

A new optional parameter "extra_specs" is introduced to request_vif in
pod-vif-drivers to distinguish among multiple vifs for a single pod

This commit also adds AnnotationMultiVIFDriver, an implementation of
multi-vif driver. A new annotation "openstack.org/kuryr-multi-vif-specs"
is introduced, which can be used by the user to request additional vifs
with given specifications.

Each vif's driver depends upon pod annotation and label of the node
where the pod is scheduled. All the vifs are then managed by the
corresponding drivers.

Change-Id: I1d1350f16092874d7f44f46df77efbad9b3cae44
Partially Implements: blueprint multi-vif-pods
Signed-off-by: Yash Gupta <y.gupta@samsung.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-11 08:33:08.000000000', 'message': 'Strip signed certificate

Certificate (ca.crt) has to be striped for some application parsers
as they might require pure base64 representation of
certificate itself, without empty characters
at the beginning nor the end of file

Change-Id: I5f58e19d03abdf040b9a5b5df2f4dd83b4c0e3a9
Closes-Bug: #1775342
(cherry picked from commit edee7030e4deee4e95e68daa1623ea305ce202e5)
'}]
commit_message:
Strip signed certificate

Certificate (ca.crt) has to be striped for some application parsers
as they might require pure base64 representation of
certificate itself, without empty characters
at the beginning nor the end of file

Change-Id: I5f58e19d03abdf040b9a5b5df2f4dd83b4c0e3a9
Closes-Bug: #1775342
(cherry picked from commit edee7030e4deee4e95e68daa1623ea305ce202e5)

subject: Add parametrization of Ironic locations
messages:
[{'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-16 16:20:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-16 16:28:18.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from umaster to custo'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-16 17:01:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

Thanks Olivier, this will be useful for kolla-ansible.'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-02-20 08:36:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Looks good, but i agree with Mark's comments"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-20 09:16:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-20 09:30:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

Thanks to both of you for the reviews and please let me know if I should "unify" the 2 images location with only ironic_base_path being configurable'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-20 09:59:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-20 12:49:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-20 13:21:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-26 08:01:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-26 08:07:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Sorry for not reworking on this earlier but just back from heavy flew recovery :-(
Thanks a lot for your comments and explanations. I think I understand and totally agree.
However concerning the fact that depending on the user locations choices the permissions can be messed up, I am afraid that we can not do much magic there aka, what if the user choose /tmp (1777) or even worse / (755) ?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-27 15:44:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-06-09 11:53:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Mark, sorry not to have looked back at this sooner but unfortunately
 I had no real opportunity to do so. Getting back to this afer such long time
I am not sure to get full set of ins and outs to solve it the way you want it as I do not
understand the 2 sets of tufts ironic locations. Thanks for giving me more insight on this
so that I can propose a proper fix for this.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-18 13:49:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Mark, sorry not to have looked back at this sooner but
 > unfortunately
 > I had no real opportunity to do so. Getting back to this afer such
 > long time
 > I am not sure to get full set of ins and outs to solve it the way
 > you want it as I do not
 > understand the 2 sets of tufts ironic locations. Thanks for giving
 > me more insight on this
 > so that I can propose a proper fix for this.

Hi Olivier. Let's go back to the start. There is no bug linked or any information in the commit description. What is it you want to be able to do? Which of the three config options that are involved do you need to be able to change?

[pxe]
images_path
instance_master_path
tftp_master_path"}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-06-19 09:34:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Mark, not so sure after all this time but I would say that I'd like to potentially make /var/lib/ironic customizable"}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-06-19 10:01:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Looking a bit deeper into this seems what I really wanted to solve is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545711/ to avoid non-functional hard links across devices'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-19 10:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Looking a bit deeper into this seems what I really wanted to solve
 > is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545711/ to avoid non-functional
 > hard links across devices

Ok, then I think the solution can be much simpler than this. We solve the same problem in kolla-ansible with a kludge [1] that sets this:

[pxe]
tftp_master_path = /httpboot/master_images

So if you add a variable, ironic_tftp_master_path, with a default of /var/lib/ironic/master_images for backwards compat, then I think this will work. This should be used in place of /tftpboot/master_images in playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/create_tftpboot.yml.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/bifrost/tasks/bootstrap.yml#L45'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-06-20 09:30:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks for the insights and I think I get most of it. However I am still confused by the fact that in the ironic.conf file we change /var/lib/ironic/master_images into say /http_boot/master_images like in kolla-ansible but in playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/create_tftpboot.yml the current default path is /tftpboot/master_images. Am I missing something ?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-20 09:34:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Thanks for the insights and I think I get most of it. However I am
 > still confused by the fact that in the ironic.conf file we change
 > /var/lib/ironic/master_images into say /http_boot/master_images
 > like in kolla-ansible but in playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/create_tftpboot.yml
 > the current default path is /tftpboot/master_images. Am I missing
 > something ?

I think that was probably just an oversight.'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-06-21 10:40:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoned for https://review.openstack.org/57707'}]

subject: Add check for (i)PXE and Ironic location coherence
messages:
[{'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-18 18:13:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-18 18:14:23.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from custo to check-and-fix-httpboot-location'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-19 09:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-19 10:18:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

I stopped reviewing when I got to the big change. This all seems like quite a lot of work. Is there a reason that your change adding parameterisation of the image caches [1] won't solve this problem?

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545373/1"}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-19 10:35:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-19 19:10:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-19 19:15:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(5 comments)

I fully understand your concern however being able to change the default location does not prevent user errors and by default the new code just exits in failure when same partition condition is not met'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-19 20:45:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-20 07:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-20 08:15:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-20 09:37:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)

> (5 comments)
 > 
 > I fully understand your concern however being able to change the
 > default location does not prevent user errors and by default the
 > new code just exits in failure when same partition condition is not
 > met

I like the idea of validating that all required locations reside on the same device, and failing if not.

I'm not too keen on the whole symlinking business - it's a bit confusing, and I'm not sure I see the benefit over changing the paths. Is the idea that configuration is easier, because it's a single boolean?

Perhaps some documentation for the new path variables, and an explanation of when they might be required would be simpler?"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-20 09:37:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I'm not -1, waiting for others' opinions."}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-20 12:49:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-20 14:29:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-20 20:37:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-21 09:45:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

I think I need to be -1 on this until the issues raised in are discussed/resolved.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545373/2/playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/create_tftpboot.yml@73'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-02-26 08:01:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-06-21 10:40:06.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoned for https://review.openstack.org/57707'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-18 18:13:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add check for (i)PXE and Ironic location coherence

By design, Ironic will be making hardlinks from /var/lib/ironic/master_images
into /httpboot. On a machine where /var is on a separate partition, deployment
will succeed but operation will fail with some errors like:

OSError: [Errno 18] Invalid cross-device link

in ironic conductor logs. This patch adds an extra check to ensure
this, generating a failure if the condition is not met but also
allowing to pass an extra use_symlinks=true value to overcome
this.

Change-Id: I263dd35e10b7a07e75dd6fc8e55e10f3676faa14
Depends-On: Id171de4a69130644a9ecce044a04cccaee6309f4
'}, {'created': '2018-02-19 09:40:05.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add check for (i)PXE and Ironic location coherence

By design, Ironic will be making hardlinks from /var/lib/ironic/master_images
into /httpboot. On a machine where /var is on a separate partition, deployment
will succeed but operation will fail with some errors like:

OSError: [Errno 18] Invalid cross-device link

in ironic conductor logs. This patch adds an extra check to ensure
this, generating a failure if the condition is not met but also
allowing to pass an extra use_symlinks=true value to overcome
this.

Change-Id: I263dd35e10b7a07e75dd6fc8e55e10f3676faa14
Depends-On: Id171de4a69130644a9ecce044a04cccaee6309f4
'}, {'created': '2018-02-19 10:35:03.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add check for (i)PXE and Ironic location coherence

in ironic conductor logs. This patch adds an extra check to ensure

allowing to pass an extra use_symlinks=true value to overcome

Change-Id: I263dd35e10b7a07e75dd6fc8e55e10f3676faa14

into /httpboot. On a machine where /var is on a separate partition, deployment

commit_message:
Add check for (i)PXE and Ironic location coherence

By design, Ironic will be making hardlinks from /var/lib/ironic/master_images
into /httpboot. On a machine where /var is on a separate partition, deployment
will succeed but operation will fail with some errors like:

OSError: [Errno 18] Invalid cross-device link

in ironic conductor logs. This patch adds an extra check to ensure
this, generating a failure if the condition is not met but also
allowing to pass an extra use_symlinks=true value to overcome
this.

Change-Id: I263dd35e10b7a07e75dd6fc8e55e10f3676faa14
Depends-On: Id171de4a69130644a9ecce044a04cccaee6309f4

commit_message:
Fix loading plugins in tests and CI

Removing OpenStack related plugins for rally framework repo
made osresources script to fail while calling osclients. The same is
true for unittests.

Let's skip some jobs in our CI to speed up merging of the fix to do not
waste nerves of other teams.

Change-Id: Ifbdd7792f04dde63fa6aaca9302acaf719b63fcc

commit_message:
Improve the error logging for zombie amphora

In the case that nova failed to delete an amphroa they will continue to send
health heartbeat messages the the health manager. This patch improves the
logging of these amphora.

It also optimizes the statistics update flow when event streaming is
disabled by removing two extra database calls.

This patch also removes the un-used BaseControllerTask class.

This patch also finally solidifies that there will be one LB per amphora.

Change-Id: Idf83b19216c680a4854c1239ed9c5bc5ce7364a7

[{'created': '2018-06-20 06:09:32.000000000', 'message': "Reach localhost via ansible local connection

SSH'ing to 127.0.0.2 provides poor users experince as
it requires additional virthost setup.

To alleviate that, use -e ansible_connection=local for
the libvirt mode of the reproducer script.

Change-Id: I0f629a277a21defac79b95c9927530e2b388d119
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Reach localhost via ansible local connection

SSH'ing to 127.0.0.2 provides poor users experince as
it requires additional virthost setup.

To alleviate that, use -e ansible_connection=local for
the libvirt mode of the reproducer script.

Change-Id: I0f629a277a21defac79b95c9927530e2b388d119
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-16 17:08:25.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Ensure that os-traits sync is attempted only at start of process

Traits sync had been tried any time a request that might involve
traits was called. If the global was set no syncing was done, but
lock handling was happening.

This change moves the syncing into the the deploy.load_app() handling.
This means that the syncing will be attempted any time a new WSGI
application is created. Most of the time this will be at the start of a
new process, but some WSGI servers have interesting threading models so
there's a (slim) possibility that it could be in a thread. Because of
this latter possibility, the locking is still in place.

Functional tests are updated to explicitly do the sync in their
setUp().

While these changes are not strictly part of extracting placement, the
consolidation and isolation of database handling code makes where to put
this stuff a bit cleaner and more evident: an update_database() method
in deploy uses an empty DbContext class from db_api to the call the
ensure_trait_sync method in resource_provider. update_database is in
deploy because it an app deployment task and because putting it in
db_api leads to circual import problems.

This is marked as WIP because this is a bit different from how things
have been done in the past so I want to be sure that we have a chat
before it is a thing.

blueprint placement-extract
Closes-Bug: #1756151

Change-Id: Ic87518948ed5bf4ab79f9819cd94714e350ce265

"}, {'created': '2018-03-30 10:21:41.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Ensure that os-traits sync is attempted only at start of process

Traits sync had been tried any time a request that might involve
traits was called. If the global was set no syncing was done, but
lock handling was happening.

This change moves the syncing into the the deploy.load_app() handling.
This means that the syncing will be attempted any time a new WSGI
application is created. Most of the time this will be at the start of a
new process, but some WSGI servers have interesting threading models so
there's a (slim) possibility that it could be in a thread. Because of
this latter possibility, the locking is still in place.

Functional tests are updated to explicitly do the sync in their
setUp().

While these changes are not strictly part of extracting placement, the
consolidation and isolation of database handling code makes where to put
this stuff a bit cleaner and more evident: an update_database() method
in deploy uses an empty DbContext class from db_api to the call the
ensure_trait_sync method in resource_provider. update_database is in
deploy because it an app deployment task and because putting it in
db_api leads to circual import problems.

This is marked as WIP because this is a bit different from how things
have been done in the past so I want to be sure that we have a chat
before it is a thing.

blueprint placement-extract
Closes-Bug: #1756151

Change-Id: Ic87518948ed5bf4ab79f9819cd94714e350ce265

consolidation and isolation of database handling code makes where to put
this stuff a bit cleaner and more evident: an update_database() method
in deploy uses an empty DbContext class from db_api to the call the
ensure_trait_sync method in resource_provider. update_database is in
deploy because it an app deployment task and because putting it in
db_api leads to circual import problems.

blueprint placement-extract
Closes-Bug: #1756151

Change-Id: Ic87518948ed5bf4ab79f9819cd94714e350ce265

Traits sync had been tried any time a request that might involve
traits was called. If the global was set no syncing was done, but
lock handling was happening.

This change moves the syncing into the the deploy.load_app() handling.
This means that the syncing will be attempted any time a new WSGI
application is created. Most of the time this will be at the start of a
new process, but some WSGI servers have interesting threading models so
there's a (slim) possibility that it could be in a thread. Because of
this latter possibility, the locking is still in place.

commit_message:
Ensure that os-traits sync is attempted only at start of process

Traits sync had been tried any time a request that might involve
traits was called. If the global was set no syncing was done, but
lock handling was happening.

This change moves the syncing into the the deploy.load_app() handling.
This means that the syncing will be attempted any time a new WSGI
application is created. Most of the time this will be at the start of a
new process, but some WSGI servers have interesting threading models so
there's a (slim) possibility that it could be in a thread. Because of
this latter possibility, the locking is still in place.

Functional tests are updated to explicitly do the sync in their
setUp(). Some changes in fixtures are required to make sure that
the database is present prior to the sync.

While these changes are not strictly part of extracting placement, the
consolidation and isolation of database handling code makes where to put
this stuff a bit cleaner and more evident: an update_database() method
in deploy uses an empty DbContext class from db_api to the call the
ensure_trait_sync method in resource_provider. update_database is in
deploy because it an app deployment task and because putting it in
db_api leads to circual import problems.

blueprint placement-extract
Closes-Bug: #1756151

Change-Id: Ic87518948ed5bf4ab79f9819cd94714e350ce265

commit_message:
Migrate Octavia to external_deploy_task

Uses external_deploy_tasks instead of workflow_tasks for the
deployment of Octavia.

Change-Id: Ib9918acac5e9fefc44cf9c7e689b89285ff82ccb
Implements: blueprint octavia-external-deploy-tasks

commit_message:
set the ceph container for pike

A patch was made that change how the containers
were pulled in [1]. A default to luminous was
set in defaults that needs to be overriden
in the release config.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/b3794ff03ab841bbbc15a339e35a7ec02b193111

Closes-Bug: #1777759
Related-Bug: #1777762
Change-Id: I82e422f30d63b2fe8808e585e2f0eed273c96b2a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-18 16:19:30.000000000', 'message': 'Use `member` instead of `Member`

Keystone now provides a set of default roles in addition to `admin`
by default [0]. This is done during the `keystone-manage bootstrap`
process.

This change aligns the `Member` role override inside ceph-rgw with the
`member` role provided from keystone.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572243/

Change-Id: I7d15bccd3136aaa39703c47b8d84e2e61f7bc3b6
'}]
commit_message:
Use `member` instead of `Member`

Keystone now provides a set of default roles in addition to `admin`
by default [0]. This is done during the `keystone-manage bootstrap`
process.

This change aligns the `Member` role override inside ceph-rgw with the
`member` role provided from keystone.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572243/

Change-Id: I7d15bccd3136aaa39703c47b8d84e2e61f7bc3b6

commit_message:
Glance : fix wrong type for value error

After ad5d4259c45940bf4ddd150aad37c5b8d1aabba6 commit merged on
helm-toolkit, glance makes lint error because there's no key for
logConfigFile.

This PS adds logConfigFile values on glance templates.

Change-Id: Ibc4271746ae8c3a997976033122b2ab1b354f255

commit_message:

commit_message:
Storwize: self assign the SCSI lun id for volume attaching

Currently, the SCSI lun id is assigned by storage. But Storwize may
assigned the same SCSI lun id for different volumes on different i/o
groups. The wrong volume may be discovered with the same wwpn and same
lun id.

This patch reverts the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/360394/,
Storwize volume driver calculates an unused SCSI lun id and sends the
SCSI lun id to storage.
To avoid the problem of patch 360394,  this patch retries 3 times to
map volume to host if there is CMMVC5879E error.

Change-Id: I3d3c61f913ff7ec8d35c8105cecc1a51accd21e7
Closes-Bug: 1757922

[{'created': '2018-01-12 07:43:44.000000000', 'message': 'Storwize: modify hyperswap host_site configuration

The hyperswap feature introduced the storwize_preferred_host_site
in the volume type.
Actually, the host_site of hyperswap volume is related to host
ports instead of volume.

This patch modifies the parameter strowzie_preferred_host_site from
StrOpt to DictOpt in the cinder back-end configuration, and removes
it from the volume type configuration.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug:  1742866

Change-Id: Ie1df4cc45c2d1f72f33beea7ddc5bb3797a34728

commit_message:
Storwize: modify hyperswap host_site configuration

The new configuration storwize_preferred_host_site was introduced in
volume type for hyperswap feature on Queens release. Actually, the
host_site is related to host rather than volume.

This patch removes the parameter storwzie_preferred_host_site from
volume type configuration and updates it from StrOpt to DictOpt in cinder
back-end configuration.

Closes-Bug:  1742866

Change-Id: Ie1df4cc45c2d1f72f33beea7ddc5bb3797a34728

commit_message:
Storwize: filter active wwpns for NPIV

Currently, both  active and offline wwpns are reported to the
fc_zone with NPIV feature.
Actually only the active wwpns should be reported.

This patch updates the cli lstargetportfc to filter the active wwpns.

Change-Id: I7b51b8ed12d1951a3e2356f88898a0779e858d41
Closes-Bug:  1756242

commit_message:
Pass DockerCephDaemonImage to CephMgr

Previously we did not pass DockerCephDaemonImage to roles where
CephMgr service was deployed isolated from the other Ceph services.

Change-Id: Icf674e17ed6a1347a6a89775b6a3f7964d28ab8e
Closes-Bug: 1775679

commit_message:
Verify host_vars and group_vars are valid yaml

Adds a validate_config method that safe_loads the files and
returns an error if the yaml is not valid.

Change-Id: I1ec34b5364ee0f1d1d1e63d050a766a2cf1886f8
Closes-Bug: 1761265

subject: Activate memcached debug only when using MemcachedDebug param.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 11166, 'name': 'Lukas Bezdicka', 'email': 'social@v3.sk', 'username': 'xbezdick'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-06-20 11:10:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2018-06-20 11:18:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-06-20 12:10:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-06-20 14:13:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-20 11:10:43.000000000', 'message': 'Activate memcached debug only when using MemcachedDebug param.

Do not activate it with Debug anymore.  We are now pushing memcached
log into stdout where they will be collected by journald.  When
activating debug, it will log there all the requests/replies to/from
memcached.  This will make the journal grows fast and clutter it
will (most of the time) useless information.

So if memcached debug is needed for some reason let the operator says
so explicitly.

Change-Id: I85b6ca421d326c6e764fade66726407b905c796d
(cherry picked from commit 1898cc5c834d921c547f29e6f1426505cc6efdde)
'}]
commit_message:
Activate memcached debug only when using MemcachedDebug param.

Do not activate it with Debug anymore.  We are now pushing memcached
log into stdout where they will be collected by journald.  When
activating debug, it will log there all the requests/replies to/from
memcached.  This will make the journal grows fast and clutter it
will (most of the time) useless information.

So if memcached debug is needed for some reason let the operator says
so explicitly.

Change-Id: I85b6ca421d326c6e764fade66726407b905c796d
(cherry picked from commit 1898cc5c834d921c547f29e6f1426505cc6efdde)

commit_message:
Set container create tasks to non-voting

There are some inter-dependencies here where the container tasks will
not pass until a few updates are in both here and elsewhere. This change
sets the container create tasks to non-voting until all of the required
updates get in.

Change-Id: I41fe8931b329581c3a346a81b2747cb962c276d6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Use the standard messaging in the parameters workbook

Update the parameters workbook to use the standard message sending
workflow. This workflow reduces the boilerplate that is copied between
workflows by defining the message structure, providing the retry logic
and ensuring the task on a "FAILED" message.

The workflow also offers optional persistence in Swift. If the plan name
is given to the workflow it will store the messages in a Swift container
named <plan_name>-messages.

Change-Id: I010b848721732a7a186dd4de183089b5e24bfd04
Related-Bug: #1757372

commit_message:
BIOS Settings: add sync_node_setting

sync_node_setting takes a list of bios settings as input
and sorts out a tuple of lists of create, update, delete
and nochange settings by comparing the given settings with
node 'bios_settings' database table.

This commit also modifies fake BIOS interface to use
sync_node_setting for testing purpose.

Change-Id: I831b3db8f4da24d88a81b4d85889f7fd6f83ffdb
Story: #1712032

commit_message:
Use RDO version of python-msgpack on RDO

python2-msgpack is python2 only, is from EPEL, and is ancient.

Use a propery tested and validated version of msgpack.

Closes-Bug: #1704894
Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <jeffrey.zhang@99cloud.net>
Change-Id: I3b33f7a9ad48e2a06ede1f79426231d720b851ae

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-21 04:08:46.000000000', 'message': "Pin embedded ansible repositories

When using the embedded ansible the external repositories used should be
pinned so that we're creating a situation where they're may be future
breakage or unexpected builds. This change updates the version of
ansible being used and locks the git repos to a given SHA.

Change-Id: Ia2dbf79a9647ba361e33ee712d3dd54edd2d53b4
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Pin embedded ansible repositories

When using the embedded ansible the external repositories used should be
pinned so that we're creating a situation where they're may be future
breakage or unexpected builds. This change updates the version of
ansible being used and locks the git repos to a given SHA.

Change-Id: Ia2dbf79a9647ba361e33ee712d3dd54edd2d53b4
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 19:03:24.000000000', 'message': 'Helm-toolkit: Updates to support openstack logging.conf

This updates the to_oslo_conf function in helm-toolkit to account
for logging.conf requiring "keys" as a key for the enabled loggers,
handlers, and formatters for the logging configuration file. To
work around limitations with gotpl, this swaps a key's value from
"key" to "keys".

This also modifies the manifest files to include volume mounts for
the logging configuration file, which is required for the jobs
in the charts to function

Change-Id: I6ae59e2736624fff5b072e89b6043b23bc8b7f5d

Once that change is merged, we can move the keystone-webhook job

commit_message:
Helm-toolkit: Updates manifests to support openstack logging.conf

This modifies the manifest files to include volume mounts for
the logging configuration file, which is required for the jobs
in the charts to function

This also makes the keystone-webhook job nonvting, as the htk
changes will break the osh-charts required for the keystone
webhook job.  The change to add the required fixes can be found
here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576001/.

Once that change is merged, we can move the keystone-webhook job
back to a voting job

Change-Id: I6ae59e2736624fff5b072e89b6043b23bc8b7f5d

commit_message:
[API] Doc snapshot and share net deletion preconditions

1. Share snapshot state must be ``available`` or ``error``.
2. Share network must not be in use by any shares or share groups.

Change-Id: I4bc81ed3677c8d65059b47b22aec2edbecf2c55f

commit_message:
Add possibility to increase Murano agent timeout

Some Murano applications require much longer time than default
1 hour to be deployed.

Change-Id: I395e9e3e8cccf70f316f313847648841822e639a
Closes-Bug: #1777670

commit_message:
Fix flavors plugin not found error

Upon the initialization of the vpnaas plugin, it gets the flavors plugin
only once. This is not working well because if the vpnaas plugin gets
loaded before the flavors service plugin, it will fail to find the
flavors service plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1773282

Change-Id: Ib4e11c8eef7831513f0fae2a45120ec396cfe3f5

[{'created': '2018-06-07 16:44:48.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I059cec653a686413dda48f67eacee41bd3677ddf
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I059cec653a686413dda48f67eacee41bd3677ddf
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Switch lxc_container_backing_store to default "dir"

It seems that the `machinectl` backing store is prone to errors and it
is causing instability in the gate since it was introduced.  Also, the
default value for it is "dir" which means 99% of deployments will be
using that value.

We should be gating for the most commonly used case, therefore, by
removing it, we're gating with a much similar environment as the one
used by our users.

Change-Id: Icc099981f2a216d6c4d10f8a23f56cac32cc932f

commit_message:
Remove unmaintained drivers

After the announcement on mailing list [1] but there is no response.
This patch intends to remove the following drivers that are unmaintained:
- CiscoCsrIPsecDriver
- FedoraStrongSwanDriver
- VyattaIPsecDriver

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-July/120264.html

Change-Id: I984a41b9a9b5c154c4be7f5bcef621fe8c5677ac

commit_message:
Fix the freezer-scheduler start failed

the start of freezer-scheduler need openstack auth which got
from env[0][1] by default, this ps to provide valid keystone
auth url with valid keystone api version to use.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/freezer/blob/master/freezer/scheduler/arguments.py#L119
[1]: https://github.com/openstack/freezer/blob/master/freezer/scheduler/arguments.py#L49

with the move of image conversion to privsep.

Closes-Bug: #1776797

commit_message:
Prevent the host update API from updating in-use extra capabilities

The host update API allows cloud admins to update extra capabilities
even though the host reservation or the instance reservation requested
the capabilities. It causes a mismatch between requested
resource_properties of reservations and extra_capabilities
registered in Blazar.

This patch prevents the API from updating extra capabilities if the key
is referred to in resource_properties.

Change-Id: I78a9dc7f448a29f31fb95432cf4eee66c865aa70
Implements: blueprint flavors-extra-specs

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I46bff5b942a31b2c33679e2f4414e003510f2687
'}]
commit_message:
Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I46bff5b942a31b2c33679e2f4414e003510f2687

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 13:46:38.000000000', 'message': "[placement] Add status field to version document at /

According to the spec [1] the version discovery doc must have a status
for each version. For the primary version the value should be 'CURRENT'.

In placement, since there is only one version at the moment, set status
to CURRENT. Add a gabbi test that verified the presence of the field and
its value.

Without this field, use of placement with a client that follows the
documented version discovery process will fail to work.

As the version doc is not considered microversioned[2] and in any case
this is making version discovery work where it didn't before, this is
not a candidate for a microversion and can be backported to the
beginning of placement's history if we like.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/microversion_specification.html#version-discovery
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-sdks/%23openstack-sdks.2018-06-13.log.html#t2018-06-13T13:40:12

Change-Id: Ie602ab1768efbf103563d8f6b9d28965fc81021a
Closes-Bug: #1776668
"}, {'created': '2018-06-13 14:39:35.000000000', 'message': "[placement] Add status field to version document at /

for each version. For the primary version the value should be 'CURRENT'.

In placement, since there is only one version at the moment, set status
to CURRENT. Add a gabbi test that verified the presence of the field and
its value.

Without this field, use of placement with a client that follows the
documented version discovery process will fail to work.

As the version doc is not considered microversioned[2] and in any case
this is making version discovery work where it didn't before, this is
not a candidate for a microversion and can be backported to the
beginning of placement's history if we like.

I've updated the api-ref docs. In the process I made the max
microversion in the sample discovery doc a bit more realistic and
in alignment with these modern times.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/microversion_specification.html#version-discovery
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-sdks/%23openstack-sdks.2018-06-13.log.html#t2018-06-13T13:40:12

Change-Id: Ie602ab1768efbf103563d8f6b9d28965fc81021a
Closes-Bug: #1776668

commit_message:
[placement] Add status and links fields to version document at /

According to the spec [1] the version discovery doc must have a status
and links for each version. For the primary version the status value
should be 'CURRENT'. For placement the version discovery doc and "self"
are the same thing, so the provided "self" href looks redundant, but it
makes keystoneauth1 happy when doing version discovery.

In placement, since there is only one version at the moment, set status
to CURRENT.

Add a gabbi test that verifies the presence of both fields and values.

Without these fields, use of placement with a client that follows the
documented version discovery process will fail to work.

As the version doc is not considered microversioned[2] and in any case
this is making version discovery work where it didn't before, this is
not a candidate for a microversion and can be backported to the
beginning of placement's history if we like.

I've updated the api-ref docs. In the process I made the max
microversion in the sample discovery doc a bit more realistic and
in alignment with these modern times.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/microversion_specification.html#version-discovery
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-sdks/%23openstack-sdks.2018-06-13.log.html#t2018-06-13T13:40:12

Change-Id: Ie602ab1768efbf103563d8f6b9d28965fc81021a
Closes-Bug: #1776668

Add notification support for trusted_certs

Add the 'trusted_image_certificates' field to InstanceCreatePayload
and InstanceActionRebuildPayload notifications.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-30 20:57:18.000000000', 'message': "Overhaul the authentication API reference

Keystone supports a bunch of different token types, but our API
reference doesn't really do a good job of explaining how to get
a token scoped to a specific thing. We also generalize a bunch of
the references in the example requests and responses. I assume this
is to be as DRY as possible, but I'm not sure that's a good thing,
because it leave the documentation pretty opaque, making it hard for
end users and consumers to know what we mean.

This commit attempts to address that by breaking the parameters for
authentication requests and responses into their own files so that we
can be more descriptive without affecting other documentation. It
also standardizes some of the naming conventations and includes
examples for all token scopes.

Change-Id: I27fb15e2b53529b91c0f2bd3a2744d60b54495c8
Closes-Bug: 1774229
"}, {'created': '2018-05-31 21:35:39.000000000', 'message': "Overhaul the authentication API reference

Keystone supports a bunch of different token types, but our API
reference doesn't really do a good job of explaining how to get
a token scoped to a specific thing. We also generalize a bunch of
the references in the example requests and responses. I assume this
is to be as DRY as possible, but I'm not sure that's a good thing,
because it leave the documentation pretty opaque, making it hard for
end users and consumers to know what we mean.

This commit attempts to address that by breaking the parameters for
authentication requests and responses into their own files so that we
can be more descriptive without affecting other documentation. It
also standardizes some of the naming conventations and includes
examples for all token scopes.

Change-Id: I27fb15e2b53529b91c0f2bd3a2744d60b54495c8
Closes-Bug: 1774229
"}, {'created': '2018-06-04 20:51:26.000000000', 'message': "Clarify scope responses in authentication api ref

The documentation was a bit misleading because it listed projects,
domains, and the system as not being optional. This is confusing
because it's not possible to scope a token to more than one target.

This commit attempts to clarify those details.

Closes-Bug: 1774229

commit_message:
Clarify scope responses in authentication api ref

The documentation was a bit misleading because it listed projects,
domains, and the system as not being optional. This is confusing
because it's not possible to scope a token to more than one target.

This commit attempts to clarify those details.

Closes-Bug: 1774229
Change-Id: I27fb15e2b53529b91c0f2bd3a2744d60b54495c8

The minimum set of permissions necessary to operate on the Ceph
pools changed with Luminous and the 'profile rbd' setting ensures
the necessary additional operations are granted. See Luminous [1]
vs Jewel [2] settings.

Closes-Bug: 1773449

1. http://docs.ceph.com/docs/luminous/rbd/rbd-openstack/#setup-ceph-client-authentication
2. http://docs.ceph.com/docs/jewel/rbd/rbd-openstack/#setup-ceph-client-authentication

(cherry picked from commit e65889dff2ae8227bcde4bd3de19022da74ca3c6)

commit_message:
Update CephX client.openstack keyring to use 'profile rbd'

The minimum set of permissions necessary to operate on the Ceph
pools changed with Luminous and the 'profile rbd' setting ensures
the necessary additional operations are granted. See Luminous [1]
vs Jewel [2] settings.

Closes-Bug: 1773449

1. http://docs.ceph.com/docs/luminous/rbd/rbd-openstack/#setup-ceph-client-authentication
2. http://docs.ceph.com/docs/jewel/rbd/rbd-openstack/#setup-ceph-client-authentication

Change-Id: I9639d606bd538f6776c368a4f34aa6783ab91abb
(cherry picked from commit e65889dff2ae8227bcde4bd3de19022da74ca3c6)

subject: Use rally 0.12.1 release for stable/ocata branch
messages: [{'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-06-19 15:55:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/pike.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-06-19 15:55:42.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1777506-stable/ocata to bug/1777506'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-06-19 20:28:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-06-20 15:00:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-06-20 15:02:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-06-20 18:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 15:55:34.000000000', 'message': 'Use rally 0.12.1 release for stable/pike patches

Rally in master branch has got too high dependencies for
Pike release thus keystone not works properly in neutron-rally
job and job fails.

Change-Id: I73ef5c978e66a89bb70be28468e0d1f40a71d94f
Closes-Bug: #1777506
'}, {'created': '2018-06-19 20:28:52.000000000', 'message': "Use rally 0.12.1 release for stable/ocata branch

Rally does not have any alignment of own tags to OpenStack releases.
In theory it should be possible to launch the latest Rally against
old clouds.

To follow the common processes and policy, Rally synchronized own
dependencies (python-*client's and oslo.* libs) with g-r. It made a
conflict between installed versions by stable/pike@devstack and rally
itself.
With Rally master branch it became an error (Rally's team is
working on moving in-tree OpenStack plugins to the separate repository
openstack/rally-openstack).
Rally 0.12.1 is the latest release which doesn't contain a breaking
change.

Ideally, to avoid such issues in future, Rally devstack plugin and
zuul job should install Rally in a virtual environment, but such
change requires more time for investigation and implementation.

So this patch is a quick workaround to avoid version conflict
of python dependencies.

Change-Id: I73ef5c978e66a89bb70be28468e0d1f40a71d94f
Closes-Bug: #1777506
"}]
commit_message:
Use rally 0.12.1 release for stable/ocata branch

Rally does not have any alignment of own tags to OpenStack releases.
In theory it should be possible to launch the latest Rally against
old clouds.

To follow the common processes and policy, Rally synchronized own
dependencies (python-*client's and oslo.* libs) with g-r. It made a
conflict between installed versions by stable/pike@devstack and rally
itself.
With Rally master branch it became an error (Rally's team is
working on moving in-tree OpenStack plugins to the separate repository
openstack/rally-openstack).
Rally 0.12.1 is the latest release which doesn't contain a breaking
change.

Ideally, to avoid such issues in future, Rally devstack plugin and
zuul job should install Rally in a virtual environment, but such
change requires more time for investigation and implementation.

So this patch is a quick workaround to avoid version conflict
of python dependencies.

Change-Id: I73ef5c978e66a89bb70be28468e0d1f40a71d94f
Closes-Bug: #1777506

commit_message:
Add openshift images to ContainerImagePrepare parameter

The openshift images landed at a similar time to this file, this
change brings this file back in sync with
overcloud-prep-containers.sh.j2.

Change-Id: I87744db5144e0835f9a326e4388028b5039d5827
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-01 03:54:31.000000000', 'message': "prep for consumer generation in API layer

Reworks the utility functions for serialization in the allocation
handler in two ways: first, decouples the calculation of the last
modified timestamp from the serialization routines. second, breaks up
the _allocations_dict() megafunction into more readable (if slightly
more verbose) _serialize_allocations_for_consumer() and
_serialize_allocations_for_resource_provider() functions. It is these
functions whose docstrings actually describe the serialization output so
it's easier to understand what is going on without the conditionals for
last modified processing and the key_fetcher stuff.

Change-Id: I6f81b5af5400cf5e06a9d0b527699160da2a2ddc
blueprint: add-consumer-generation

commit_message:
rework allocation handler _allocations_dict()

This is preparation for requiring consumer generation in API requests
and responses.

Reworks the utility functions for serialization in the allocation
handler in two ways: first, decouples the calculation of the last
modified timestamp from the serialization routines. second, breaks up
the _allocations_dict() megafunction into more readable (if slightly
more verbose) _serialize_allocations_for_consumer() and
_serialize_allocations_for_resource_provider() functions. It is these
functions whose docstrings actually describe the serialization output so
it's easier to understand what is going on without the conditionals for
last modified processing and the key_fetcher stuff.

Change-Id: I6f81b5af5400cf5e06a9d0b527699160da2a2ddc
blueprint: add-consumer-generation

commit_message:
Do a fail fast if there are pip install issues

The script quickstart.sh was not failing
at the pip install line, adding a check of the
rc after the () block and returnig the same rc.

Depends-On: I9d561aa2e2f71b8892580950e9664d62f956773d

Change-Id: Ib7a46e4c15a93c62bdde66495030e4734728a890
Closes-Bug: 1708986

commit_message:
Keep ORM names matching their VO counterparts

Now cinder had some Versioned Objects which names do not
match their ORM counterparts. In method: get_model_for_versioned_object,
we handles those exceptions.

This patch fix this issue to keep the names match.

Change-Id: Icf709d87be99df95e5b52204032b730cd790096c
Closes-Bug: #1493112

Removes the project_id and user_id fields from the Allocation object
definition. These values are now found in the Consumer object that is
embedded in the Allocation object which is now non-nullable.

Modifies the serialization in the allocation handler to look for a the
missing sentinel in Allocation.consumer.project.external_id field when
outputting the project_id and user_id JSON output (when appropriate for
the microversion)

commit_message:
placement: Allocation.consumer field

Removes the consumer_id, project_id and user_id fields from the
Allocation object definition. These values are now found in the Consumer
object that is embedded in the Allocation object which is now
non-nullable.

Modifies the serialization in the allocation handler to output
Allocation.consumer.project.external_id and
Allocation.consumer.user.external_id when appropriate for the
microversion.

Calls the create_incomplete_consumers() method during
AllocationList.get_all_by_consumer_id() and
AllocationList.get_all_by_resource_provider() to online-migrate missing
consumer records.

Change-Id: Icae5038190ab8c7bbdb38d54ae909fcbf9048912
blueprint: add-consumer-generation

Good catch!. It would be good to add a test for this i.e remove a external_fixed_ip when updating the router.'}, {'account_id': 22776, 'date': '2018-06-20 17:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from stx_bug_fix to stx-bug-fix'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-20 19:51:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Ouch.

It's mind-boggling to me that anybody could have made this fix and thought it was not worth submitting upstream at the time. Better late than never though, thanks Nakul!"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 21:16:25.000000000', 'message': 'External_fixed_ips break router creation.

In the _resolve_subnet method the code iterates over a dictionary
while modifying it using the "pop" command. This is incorrect and
causes a Runtime error.

The fix is to make a copy, iterate over that  while manipulating the original
dictionary. Python 2.7 can do this using iter(), however python 3 would not
have worked. The fix does a copy first which makes the code operate the same
in both interpreters, since there is no "six" routine for this.

Change-Id: I11468bfbe7fafd5c0d79138a94520dec1aafbc04
Story: 2002549
Task: 22111
'}]
commit_message:
External_fixed_ips break router creation.

In the _resolve_subnet method the code iterates over a dictionary
while modifying it using the "pop" command. This is incorrect and
causes a Runtime error.

The fix is to make a copy, iterate over that  while manipulating the original
dictionary. Python 2.7 can do this using iter(), however python 3 would not
have worked. The fix does a copy first which makes the code operate the same
in both interpreters, since there is no "six" routine for this.

Change-Id: I11468bfbe7fafd5c0d79138a94520dec1aafbc04
Story: 2002549
Task: 22111

commit_message:
[evil] Remove OpenStack related plugins

NOTE: the existing legacy jobs should continue working due to several
applied hacks.

The new home for OpenStack plugins:
  https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/rally-openstack
  https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack
  https://pypi.org/project/rally-openstack/

Change-Id: I36e56759f02fe9560b454b7a396e0493da0be0ab

commit_message:
Support availability-zone in volume type

Since 3.52, new option '--filters' has been
added to 'type-list' command, and it's only
valid for administrator.

Change-Id: I140f6d61a2747d4fcaabfbccea864dcc7eb841d1
Depends-On: I4e6aa7af707bd063e7edf2b0bf28e3071ad5c67a
Partial-Implements: bp support-az-in-volumetype

commit_message:
Add traversal spec for datastoreFolder

StoragePods (a.k.a datastore clusters) are located under
Datacenter.datastoreFolder, so we need a new traversal spec in order to
retrieve them.

Change-Id: I899f8f6ef05a94d21d13a55ca0a0f8fbd042a448

Add support for project-specific limits

Thsi commit adds client support for managing limits in keystone.

bp unified-limits

Change-Id: I33251dbd4d3bfaf178ca86a2f5d564ac94879dd2

commit_message:
Update nova-status & docs: require placement 1.25

Change I496e8d64907fdcb0e2da255725aed1fc529725f2 made nova-scheduler
require placement >= 1.25 so this change updates the minimum required
version checked in the nova-status upgrade check command along with the
upgrade docs.

related to blueprint: granular-resource-requests

Change-Id: I0a17ee362461a8ae2113804687799bb9d9216110

seems quota-set is not a right example, but I agree that we can just support single create now.

Leave the multi-create patch there to get more feedback.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-06-06 13:53:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add support for registered limits

This change add client support for creating, reading, updating, and
deleting registered limits.

A subsequent patch will do the same for project-specific limits.

bp unified-limits
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569741/
Change-Id: I6b5d106d08af53c2ad41ed3f799e9e71d370c6dd

commit_message:
Add ansible helper to Linux dev environment info

This adds instructions on how to use an Ansible playbook to
quickly get a working dev environment set up for Linux
environments as an alternative options to manually installing
packages

Change-Id: Ib9d932fca7002299537a1c0da4053a671ce3ccb1

[{'created': '2018-06-19 03:00:24.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to using project-templates

In order to have more centralized configuration, switch the role

commit_message:
Switch to using project-templates

In order to have more centralized configuration, switch the role
to use the project-template instead.

Change-Id: I067a5ca85261128e73e000463d2b75d43630506e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 17:02:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix broken SDK exception test

In openstacksdk 0.14.0 release, a bug related to SDK exception was fixed:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571101/. With that change a SDK exception will
contain the detailed message only if the message string is equal to 'Error'.

This commit fixes the test_parse_exception_http_exception_no_details to use
'Error' as the exception message to make the test case pass.

Change-Id: I61368430e0f8e8316e13276452da05041920ce4e
"}, {'created': '2018-06-19 17:04:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix broken SDK exception test

In openstacksdk 0.14.0 release, a bug related to SDK exception was
fixed: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571101/. With that change a SDK

is equal to 'Error'.

use 'Error' as the exception message to make the test case pass.

Change-Id: I61368430e0f8e8316e13276452da05041920ce4e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix broken SDK exception test

In openstacksdk 0.14.0 release, a bug related to SDK exception was
fixed: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571101/. With that change a SDK
exception will contain the detailed message only if the message string
is equal to 'Error'.

This commit fixes the test_parse_exception_http_exception_no_details to
use 'Error' as the exception message to make the test case pass.

Change-Id: I61368430e0f8e8316e13276452da05041920ce4e

commit_message:
Add enhanced KVM storage QoS quotas

This will add additonal KVM-based qoutas for Cinder front-end QoS

The new quotas are:

 - read_bytes_sec_max
 - write_bytes_sec_max
 - total_bytes_sec_max
 - read_iops_sec_max
 - write_iops_sec_max
 - total_iops_sec_max
 - size_iops_sec

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/574804
Change-Id: I5a8f34c7ed3dea940700dffd54bc7d44f7518ab4
Implements: blueprint enhanced-kvm-storage-qos

[{'created': '2018-06-16 21:05:00.000000000', 'message': 'Align logging on oslo_log

This patch aligns all of Octavia to use oslo_log instead of the built
in python logging. This should provide consistent log formats.

It adds a hacking check to make sure "logging" doesn't come back into
the code.

commit_message:
Align logging on oslo_log

This patch aligns all of Octavia to use oslo_log instead of the built
in python logging. This should provide consistent log formats.

It adds a hacking check to make sure "logging" doesn't come back into
the code.

Change-Id: I9b76c2bb5a5c396faf85df4606f2ca00f23de913

commit_message:
Use valid eventlet logger method

eventlet<=0.17.4 LoggerFileWrapper does not have an error() method
so don't try to call it. Instead, use info() which even in newer
eventlet versions does exactly the same as error().

This bug only manifests in unit tests once the Related-Bug has been fixed
(see Related-Change).

Closes-Bug: #1777836
Related-Bug: #1777701
Related-Change: I68fd9d0263a6720aaf0d90b8ea6da1158105ac01

Change-Id: I46190567549826c811ffa51e9a71a38a20d9ce97

subject: Add ability to load inventory from a file
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-18 21:28:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add ability to load inventory from a file

It would be helpful to have the ability to populate the
kolla-cli inventory file from any inventory file, not just the
all-in-one file from kolla.

To do this, The config reset command has been updated to take
an optional --inventory path argument that will cause the new
inventory to be generated from that anible inventory file.

While doing this found a few things to fix:

- renamed allineone.py & AllInOne to AnsibleInventory to better reflect
what they are now doing.

- In kolla_actions, preserve the empty globals.yml file (otherwise
the soft linkage is broken) and fix the kolla-cli directory name.

Change-Id: Ib250c5de8e00818b41c1a4539aba8c165a4ad2e2
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to load inventory from a file

It would be helpful to have the ability to populate the
kolla-cli inventory file from any inventory file, not just the
all-in-one file from kolla.

To do this, The config reset command has been updated to take
an optional --inventory path argument that will cause the new
inventory to be generated from that anible inventory file.

While doing this found a few things to fix:

- renamed allineone.py & AllInOne to AnsibleInventory to better reflect
what they are now doing.

- In kolla_actions, preserve the empty globals.yml file (otherwise
the soft linkage is broken) and fix the kolla-cli directory name.

Change-Id: Ib250c5de8e00818b41c1a4539aba8c165a4ad2e2

[{'created': '2018-06-18 10:37:30.000000000', 'message': "Fix ordering for --diff mode setup

Due to the ordering of the vars passed to the _get_diff_data mode,
--diff mode would only work with --check activated, otherwise the file
used didn't exist and you would get an error similar to:

https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/issues/2742

This PR allows this to work by configuring the diff data before running
the copy module, so the file exists.

Change-Id: I020a181731c3ee87f04933f8c62213ea12cfa3a4
"}, {'created': '2018-06-20 13:04:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix ordering for --diff mode setup

Due to the ordering of the vars passed to the _get_diff_data mode,
--diff mode would only work with --check activated, otherwise the file
used didn't exist and you would get an error similar to:

https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/issues/2742

This PR allows this to work by configuring the diff data before running
the copy module, so the file exists.

Additionally, we should run with --diff mode enabled by default on tests
for this repository to ensure any functional issues with diff mode are
caught.

Change-Id: I020a181731c3ee87f04933f8c62213ea12cfa3a4
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ordering for --diff mode setup

Due to the ordering of the vars passed to the _get_diff_data mode,
--diff mode would only work with --check activated, otherwise the file
used didn't exist and you would get an error similar to:

https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/issues/2742

This PR allows this to work by configuring the diff data before running
the copy module, so the file exists.

Additionally, we should run with --diff mode enabled by default on tests
for this repository to ensure any functional issues with diff mode are
caught.

Change-Id: I020a181731c3ee87f04933f8c62213ea12cfa3a4

commit_message:
Add packages required for osprofiler

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.
these packages will provide deployers the ability to profile
a service on demand should they choose to enable the profile
functionality.

Change-Id: Ie8fd948efda21a7b5bd948086c2d083347489781
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Convert ironic virt driver to update_provider_tree

Port IronicDriver's get_inventory and get_traits methods over to
update_provider_tree.

IronicDriver was the only (in-tree) virt driver using get_traits.
Since virt drivers should be using update_provider_tree to communicate
traits back to the resource tracker, get_traits is no longer needed and
is removed from the ComputeDriver interface.

Change-Id: I7bcc19e60e9a56bddeae15af7b6b161b66191db3

commit_message:
Fix test_wsgi.py tests failing with eventlet <=0.18.4

Older versions of eventlet expect getsocketname() to return a tuple,
and newer versions are happy to receive a tuple, so fix the mock to
return a tuple.

Change-Id: I68fd9d0263a6720aaf0d90b8ea6da1158105ac01
Closes-Bug: #1777701

commit_message:
[placement] replace deprecated accept.best_match

Webob has deprecated the best_match[1] method on accept headers and now
spews warnings when it sees it.

This change fixes it by using the equivalent (but more correct with
regard to the relevant RFCs[2]) acceptable_offers[3] method.

Existing unit tests in placement/test_util.py cover this change.

[1] https://docs.pylonsproject.org/projects/webob/en/stable/api/webob.html#webob.acceptparse.AcceptValidHeader.best_match
[2] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-5.3.2
[3] https://docs.pylonsproject.org/projects/webob/en/stable/api/webob.html#webob.acceptparse.AcceptValidHeader.acceptable_offers

Change-Id: Ie4d81fa178b3ed6b2a7b450b4978009486f07810
Closes-Bug: #1773225

commit_message:
Optimize member_of check for nested providers

This patch adds optional `rp_ids` argument to
_provider_ids_matching_aggregates() for optimization to further
winnow results to a set of resource provider IDs in case that
we've already looked up the providers that have appropriate
inventory capacity getting allocation candidates.

Change-Id: I2a4a5c4bbaefd71ef102f25b8f35522287d2783d

Thanks for noticing this.  These changes look fine, except the *.po files ... they must be changed in the translations project or your changes will be overwritten.

See https://docs.openstack.org/i18n/latest/reviewing-translation-import.html

That page should have some info about how to make the fix.  You can file a bug with the translations team, or possibly put up a patch (ask in #openstack-i18n if you want to put up a patch, I'm not sure what the process is).

So for this patch, just remove the changes to the *.po files and it should be good to go."}, {'account_id': 27565, 'date': '2018-06-07 09:03:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27882, 'date': '2018-06-15 08:08:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-06-20 15:25:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

commit_message:
Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: I9b8830179fb98f3a6bef479bbaa12df70311269a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 23:23:21.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: FloatingIP create throws an error if no l3 agent

FloatingIP create throws an error if the L3 agent is not running
on the given host for DVR Routers.
This happens when we try to create a DVR Router in the Legacy
Router deployed cloud.
FloatingIP create checks for the agent type based on the host,
and when agents are not available on the given host, it raises
an exception.
This patch will fixes by handling the exception raised, when the
agent is not available.

Change-Id: I80522d12087495861e832cf1c7a3fe9a7830d386
Closes-Bug: #1776566
